Preface

 

What are we talking about? Yes, of course not about the flower growing in the meadow to the delight of cows. We are talking about software, about the loader of operating systems, tothe back allows on a normal computer to run an unusual system - Mac OSX. Apple does not allow this to happen, primarily because "we cannot keep computers that are not manufactured by Apple working." Well, we puttheinstum at your own risk.

To download  Makos  on  Hakintosha, you need a special  loader, there are  many different, but at its core  can be divided into two classes: FakeEFI and RealEFI. FakeEFI  was invented by David Elliot many years ago, and acted on a simple  principle:

Let's pretend that we have EFI has already workedtala, leave in memory traces of its activities (boot-args and all the tree tables), leave in the memory of EfiRuntime in a simplified form "Not supported" and launch the coreof themach_kernel.

January 2013: It happened! iMessage stopped working because he definitely needs SetVariable, which in Chameleon "Ne is supported."

RealEFI would have to be stitched instead of BIOS, but forthose withbios-based motherboards invented the downloadable EFI. This EFI download system on a machine with BIOS was invented by Intel, an open source project on the tianocore.org website. (The original project has sunk into oblivion! catcher). Actually, this loader is called DUET. But here's the trouble, EFI is something it loads, but the download of the operating system Mac OSX is not provided there. The next step is to adapt DUET to Mac OSX requirements. EFI's new motherboards are alreadyavailable, but it's also unsuitable for Hkintosh downloads. Clover serves for both categories.

The name Clover owes this uploader to one of thekabyl's project founders, who saw the similarity of the "Command" key, existing only on the Macs, with the four-leaf clover.

 

The four-layer  cleaveris a single  clover  plant  with at least  one four-plate  leaf,unlike the usual three-platedinch. In  Western  tradition,  there is  a belief  that  

the plant brings  good luck  to the founder,   especially if  it  is  found byaccident.

According to legend, each of the records of the four-plate sheet representssomething concrete: the first -  hope,the second -  faith,the third -  love,and the fourth  - good luck.

 

By the way, the original green logo looks more like a hare than a clover. Namely Oxalis, and it is in flower shops as three-leaf and four-leaf :)

Timeline of development

The need for a new loader arose from Chameleon's inability to download the then-emerging  10.7 (Lion) system.

The project started on March 4, 2011 on the initiative of       Kabyl,  who,  however,  telling all that he had managedtodo  by that  time,  from  the development evaded, and  soon disappeared altogether. 

The first launch of the MacOSX system was modified dueT on April 6, 2011. http://www.projectosx.com/forum/index.php? showtopic=2008&view=findpost&p=13810

On May 4, serious problems of the new loader were formulated, without their solution there was no sense in the new project. The pause lasted until August, for itseemed unrealistic to deal with these problems alone.

Meanwhile, Chameleon came to life, having coped with Lyon's boot, and I worked on my brunch for a while. However, the administrators of chameleon ignored me, so I gave it up. Then There was Ninzya with hisiBoot, and I joined him in trying to make an EFI-bootloader and solve the hanging problems.

August 9, 2011 with the participation of dmdimon made a Russian font for the loader. In the meantime, I'm doing SMBIOS and ACPI at a much higher level than I did in Chameleon.

October 19, 2011 finally solved the sampleof the lem launch Of Blow on a laptop.

November 14, 2011 the appearance of cats in the interface of Clover. That is for 10.4 draw Tiger, for 10.5 Leopard and so on. It's a nice innovation! Appearance plays a role.

On December 14, 2011, the problem of panicand memory on the junior OSX systems, lyon and older such problems for some reason was not solved.

05 January 2012 solved the problem of sleep. It was from that moment that the project could be considered viable. By this time, Ninzja had already left the stage, and I decided to start my own project of the uploader's graphics menu based on the already known rEFIt. He

licensed clean, and now it was possible to fight for international recognition of the project. That's how Clover-v2 came about.

The new shell took two months to create, and the first publication took place on February 29, 2012. In fact, rEFIt already  existed, itwasnot  suitable  for  compilation in the EDK2 environment, and all its libraries had to be rewritten and replaced with their own.   In  the course of cooperation with jadran, the  project's compilation tools were developed. Now  with the help of gcc-4.4, and now 64 bits.

On March 9, 2012, Dmazar, who has known me since August 2011, joined the project with his idea to make a UEFI loader based on Clover.

On March 31, 2012, Gyk did interactivity to enter the parameters in the loader shell - Options Menu.

OnApril 1, 2012, a crazybirdy made Clover's installer.

On April 21, 2012, Dmazar defeated UEFI boot, but continued to work on the project

improve and correct. That is, OsxAptioFixDrv was created.

On June 5, 2012 pcj appeared and offered its sources with new technologies: DSDT patch, Kexts Inject, Kernel patch, which took our loader to a whole new level, unattainable by competitors.

September 18, 2012. Pena called me and Dmazar tothink about the iCloud problem.

September 30, 2012 the appearance of a mouse in the loader interface. On October 19, 2012, an animation was made in the loader shell.

October - December 2012 step by step made a native resolution in the downloader dlI Nvidia, ATI, Intel, for CloverEFI and for UEFI.

These achievements have raised the bar, as should be the graphical interface of a good loader. I would also like to acknowledge Blackosx's contribution to improving support for topics.

January 9, 2013 solved the problem of paid iMessage, which could not be done in Chameleon.

Spring 2013. With the efforts of JrCs Clover, theadditional utilities and internationalization. 20 languages in the installer, control panel and automatic update service.

July 27, 2013 finally solved the problem of sleep at UEFI loading, hanging since the fall of 2012. It seems with the OS update appeared.

September 29, 2013 also corrected care to sleep, turn off and restart at UEFI loading. From now on, you can put UEFIdownloads as the primary method on those computers where possible.

20       January 2014 is made the possibility of deep sleep - Hibernation. Not in all cases, but for now Clover is the only loader  that  can.  

February 2014. The "Project of the Month" awardis sorceforge.net.

April 5, 2014. The completion of the development was announced at the audit of 2652. This, of course, does not negate possible improvements in the future, just nothing will change drastically  the basic already done.

June 2014. Apple laid out the 10.10DP1 Yosemite system, the first installation successes and new fixes in Clover for the new system. And then it turned out that Chameleon is not able to download this system. There are single successful reports from bareBoot and Ozmosis downloaders, which are also EFI loaders using some of Clover's codes. Clover has become the main Hakintoszewski downloader.

21       August 2014. Dmazar fixedthe NVRAM at UEFI download for  some  who  didn't work   before.

Meanwhile, the 2k version overstepped 3,000 revisions. A new compiler with LTO optimization, new code size, fixes of old bugs, improvements in algorithms. Almost nothing new, but Clover got better.

January 2015. Once Clover-3, anothized by Apianti, is still not available, Clover-2 has acquired a 2.3k version that reflects the revision of the zgt;3000.

All the developers dispersed, the site projectosx.com ceased to exist. I'm left alone, but I keep workingat, albeit without much zeal.

June 2015. The 10.11 El Capitan system. Clover downloaded it without question.

The chameleon is stuck again. We did, but, as I see, the usual users do   not show interest in Chameleon.   Interest is shown  only by all the same 6 people who support him. Chameleon/Chimera is still used by newcomers, Who started life with  Multibista,  and have not yet heard about Clover, or users of AMD CPU,  who are   not  developers,  and they just do not  know what to do  with Clover.

I would like to note that  Clover's  comawas joined by Vector-sigma, who  took over the entire user-space.app.       That is,  controls everything that used to be under the tutelage of  JrCs.

September 2019. We overhauled the entire project, moved to GitHub, which became a stable and fast site after Microsoft bought it, and with it the following changes:

-      Clover's   sources are controlled not by the SVN  protocol, but by the GIT protocol.     This  has its drawbacks, namely the problem with the numbering of audits, but there are also advantages, such as the ability to do a bisection to find a recently made  error.

-      tired of splashing around for strange "improvements" EDK2.                Before that, used a stable version       of    UDK2018, but it is clearly outdated, and with the new EDK2 Clover was simply incompatible.       It's    about  supporting  legaic computers on Core2Duo and the like.   Now  Clover does not need external libraries, everything        you need  to be in  his  repository, and all this will be updated by Clover's developers, based on the changes in EDK2.      

-         nowthe main compiler of the  project is gcc-10, unlike the Klang it is able to carry out LinkTimeOptimisation, that is, discarding unused libraries during the linking phase.    In  doing  so,  we get an additional diagonalof possibleerrors.  And other  bugs could have gone.

-      The structure of the drivers' folders has been changed because we have completely abandoned the idea  of compiling  32bits, and the 64bit indication is  redundant.

-      The structure of kexts folders has been changed, and you can now connect  and  disable different versions of cupcakes in the interface to check  which one works best.  

January 2020. Clover's next major transformation. There was a new developer Jief Machak, who offered to transfer the project to CJ. It's non-trivial.

But it didn't come empty-handed, he brought the necessary files, dated 1997, obviously even then solved the problem with CJ.

I accepted the challenge and here we are in the team have started the transformation in Clover.

I have to use them. Let's leave Linus Torvalds alone with his curses to CJ, his motives are clear, Linux is already written on C, and it is no longer remade, it remains only to look for this justifiedand. We introduce new programming paradigms and rewrite codes for newrequirements.  that before could not untangle.

OpenCore is already  loading BigSur  because  vit9696 has made loading  cupcakes directly into the cache, and the Clover  method of injecting into the BigSur device tree with  its new safety requirements has been rejected. compiled as a whole, launched as Clover and looks like Clover with his GIUs and settings, and when selecting a system to be downloaded, delegates authority to OpenCore and gives it control.

 

 

Tactical specifications

EFI - Extensible Firmware Interface is an expandable access interface for hardware-dependent features. Unlike BIOS, which occupies 64kb and is written in 16-bit codes, EFI occupies from 4MB, is written in 32 or 64-bit codes, and is positioned as ahardware-on-the-independent though... Of course, miracles do not happen, and 100% compatibility with any platform is impossible to achieve. The real UEFI BIOS is of course hardware-dependent.

Clover is an EFI operating system loader for computers already  with UEFI BIOS (Unified EFI...), and for computers that  do not have  one. At the            same     time,  the operating systems themselves can support EFI-loading (OSX, Windows 7-64EFI, Linux), or not (Windows XP), in the latter case provided a legacy-boot - a return to the old  scheme  of BIOS-loading through the boot sectors. 

EFI isn't just the initial loading phase of the OS, it also creates tables and services that are available for use in the OS, and its performance depends on the correctness of this stage. CloverEFI and CloverGUI do a lot of work to adjust the built-in tables to enable  OSX to run:

-  The SMBIOS (DMI) table is filled with data that emulates real-world Apple Macintosh computers - a condition for the launch of OSX.   However, it is desirable that the user substituted unique numbers. Why,    for example, grub does not              loadt Hacos?

-  ACPI tables contained in the computer's ROM tend to contain errors and flaws, most often because of the laziness of the manufacturers: in the APIC table the wrong number of CPU   cores, the NMI data is missing from the FACP      table,  there is no Reset   register,  the wrong power profile, the SSDT tables do not have data for  EIST,  and  there is no data for DSDT at all. That  is, MAKOS has its own requirements for ATPI,  which do not coincide with the ATPI of conventional  computers. Clover is trying to fix it all;

-  OSX also  aims to  get  data  from  the downloader  on  additional  devices such as graphics card, network, sound,    etc. through the Device Properties string mechanism. Clover generates such  information;

-  BIOS-based computers are characterized by the use of USB in the early stages of downloading in Legasi mode, which becomes unacceptable when    transferring  control to the OS.

-  OSX also exchanges information with EFI through a special NVRAM memory, which  is accessed through RuntimeSevices, which are not available in the legas loaders. Clover  provides  this    two-way exchange, which gives Firewire the right job, the ability to download Nwidia's Web Driver, the ability to use the "Boot Drive" control panel to  automatically  reboot to another     system. NVRAM is needed for the ability to register inthe services xiCloud and iMessage, for hibernation, for the work of  FileVault2,  etc.;

-  You need a ConsoleControl protocol that's missing from The Blow, other similar little things;

-  it is necessary to  fill out  some data in the EFI/Platform through the DataHub protocol, absent from the Blowa, and not  always  present in UEFI. The most serious value of FSBFrequency, the definition of which  is the loader's task, the data in the DMI is inaccurate, or not at  all,  and we use this  protocol  for  sensors, and not  all  hacking officers  use it,    and  someone goes his own  way,  and  wonders  why  it  does not  work;

-  before the CPU starts, it must be properly initiated, but since the system boards are made universal, for a whole range of different CPU,  the internal tables do not have data on the    processor,  or there are some universal, incorrect in the hour-darkcase.  

complete detection of the installed CPU and makes the necessary corrections in the tables, and in the CPU itself. As one of the results - the Turbo mode is turned on;

-  BIOS somehow uses computer memory,  breaks down into regions aboutthelimiting destination, but often it is not done in the way it needs to run macOS; The  OsxAptioFixDrv driver and  its descendants, which for a number of reasons are allocated from Clover to a separate module, are involved in the adjustment of the memory card, and other related details, so as not to interfere with  the legoshi-loading;

-  Another  little thing. The sources of  DUET, and the entire EDK2 are written universal  under  different  irons. .. but  the dependence on iron is made through constants. That  is

It is assumed that the user compiles the Blow none specific configuration.

 

All of this is done automatically, and the newcomer          can  use Clover without even understanding anything about the  problems. Their consideration is the purpose of this         book.   This is the wrong  approach. Config  will be  corrected after you try to download something.   

 

What's what?

 

In a nutshell, Clover has four main functions:

1.  Intercepts control, so that not BIOS loaded the operating        system,  so that it is done through Clover. 

2.  Modifying the data  that  BIOS transmits to the operating system is  the basic requirement for downloading MACOS.  

3.  Modis the MacOS system itself to work on  this  iron.

4.  In some  cases, Clover corrects the state of the devices,  which theB.S.A. did not doat the time.

Windows and Linux do not need paragraph 3, and the second is rare. But on the first point clarifications are needed, as beginners start with the question "Why not ship." When you turn on or reboot yourcomputer, the operating system is loaded with Clover on the next path.

OptionA. A computer  based on BIOS (legasi-loading)  BIOS→MBR→PBR→boot→CLOVERX64.efi→OSloader     (boot.efi in the case of MacOSX, bootmgfw.efi for Windows, grub.efi for  Linux).

Wonder? Words:

1.        When the computer  starts, he  chooses which disk to start from  if the legas load.

2.       BIOS reads the zero sector from  this  diska. The codes  are written into memory, and BIOS transfers control to them.  

3.       The program embedded in  MBR  looks for  a  download  section  on  this  disk,  reads from there the first sector in memory, and transfers  it to the code  management.  

4.       The program embedded in PBR searches for a file with the name of the boot in its file system, uploads it to memory,   and transfers it to  control.  

5.       CloverEFI searches for the CloverX64.efi file,  downloads  it,   and hands  it over control.    

OptionB. Computer based on UEFI BIOS (new circuit, UEFI-download)

UEFI_BIOS→CLOVERX64.efi→OSloader (or BootX64.efi)

1-5. If UEFI BIOS, it is able to find the  starter EFI  module  in the EFI section.     Efi. In  some  BIOS the name EFI/microsoft/boot/bootmgfw.efi is sewn. Efi.  This  is the only thing you need    to learn. EFI is also replaced  by Clover.

6.       Finally we downloaded CLOVERX64. EFI, we see a selection of operating systems, and  we can download some of them.

 

For all this to happen, the following files must bepro-sled in the following places:

MBR Sector

zero block of external media from which the download occurs (HDD, SSD, USB Stick, USB HDD, DVD). In this block should write down the first 440 bytes one of the options:

boot0af (Active  First) is its  role in finding    an  active  section  in the MBR disk marking,  and  transferring  control to  its  PBR sector. A hybrid  MBR/GPT   scheme  is possible.  If the markup is pure                     GPT,  i.e. there are no active sections, then there is a transfer  of control to the EFI section,  which is recognizedbyTHE C12A7328-F81F-11D2-BA4B-00A0C93EC93B. If you  suddenly  reformat this section, check  what it now guid.  boot0ss (Scan Signature)  - search for the first section with  0xAF signature,  i.e. This      way you can download the system from  the HFS  section  on the  GPT  marked  disk,  but  only from the  first  such  section. If  such a section is not found, the FAT32,  or  ExFAT sections,  in  this signature check order, continues to be searched  and transferred to it. 

boot0ab - search for a section with a signature 0xAB - Apple Boot Partition. That is Recovery.

boot0md is a combination option that searches for a section on multiple drives, not just the main one.

PBR Sector

the first blocks of each section on the chosen media. This downloader knows the file system of its section, and is able to find a file with the name boot to download it and transfer control to it.

boot1h2 - for the HFS file system and support the length of the boot file up to 472kb. The old version of boot1h distributed with the loader "Chameleon" supports only 440kb file (472). For those who first installed Chameleon, once again remind: the PBR sector must be updated with a boot1h file from  the Clover kit, otherwise it will not start. The boot1h2 option has a pause of 2 seconds to switch the loader.

boot1h - too, but without pause.

boot1f32alt - for the FILE system FAT32. This file system has recording support, so it is very convenient to install a downloader on it. 

2: for historical reasons recommend to reformat every flash drive, and even necessarily in the Windows system. This recommendation is now out of date and has no basis.

boot1f32 is a non-pause option.

Attention! FileI system should be exactly  FAT32,  not MSDOS, for  FAT16  is unacceptable.

boot1x - zenith432 has made a boot-sector that   is designed for the exFAT file system.   Unfortunately, the driver inside Clover is  only  ReadOnly, however,  this file system is very interesting for external media, because it supports files more than 4GB, and  is supported by recording by both  Mac  and Windowes.

These sectors (to say the phase 2 loaders) have another useful function. They have an initial delay at a start of two seconds while waiting for input from the keyboard. The entered figure will be attached to the file name, i.e. by clicking key 1 on the black Ekranot at the beginning of the download (after the MESSAGE of BIOS "booting from...") we will download the boot1 file by clicking the 3rd you will download the boot3 file by pressing the 6th button we will download the boot6 file. The point is to keep different downloader options in one place, or even differentdownloaders, just by giving them different numbers.

boot - Clover, current version, or test version of boot1 - Chameleon

boot3 - Clover-32bit, proven, working version (displays the number 3) boot4 - Clover-32bit, with BiosBlockIO driver

boot5 - Clover-64bit, shortened size, so as not to overlap EBDA (see below) boot6 - Clover-64bit, proven, working version (displays the number 6)

boot7 is a Clover-64bit with a BiosBlockIO driver that works with any controllers that are supported by BIOS. (displays the letter B or L or 7)

In addition to these options, the PBR sector may include a Windows boot manager who knows the NTFS file system; Grub, who knows the EXT4 file system; and others unrelated to Clover.

Boot or CloverEFI

In the case of Chameleon, the "boot" file is the entire loader. In Clover's case, this file has the entire EFI system, as well as a supportservice to transfer control to the next stage.

It really turns out that there is not all, and some details (so-called driver) should be downloaded additionally. Details already collected in the A-variant A boot file.

Unlike previous stages, the boot file is already different in bitness, i.e. individual variants for 32 and 64 bit downloads. In most cases, you should choose 64bit option, if the processor supports this set of instructions (inmania! Pentium 4 and Yonah

only 32 bits).

However, if for some reason it is supposed to work only in a 32-bit OS, it makes sense to ship EFI32. It is 20% smaller and faster. Unfortunately, it is incompatible with Windows 7 EFI, which is always 64bit. November 2016: Goodbye, Clover-32!

At its core, the boot file is a modified DUET. And fixes are essentially unlikely to get 1%, but this percentage is astark difference from Blowing - Clover is working for the purpose for which he's meant. This is far from the case, but I have no purpose to describe all the intricaciesof this development.However, the functionality of CloverEFI hasn't changed for a very long time, so if you have a problem with the new

version, put the version that  worked for you. So  in the  compl,which was officially distributed on the SF.NET included an old file boot7-MCP79, because for some reason the new boot7 stopped working with this chipset.

It's another minor problem. PBR is looking for a boot file. But the Windows installer has a folder with that name, there's a single boot in boot5, and I've been using an alternative download.

CLOVERIA32.efi and CLOVERX64.efi or CloverGUI

This file, in two variations of varying bits, is a loader's graphic shell for selecting an operating system, To install additional options, to load additional drivers and to start theOS. Graphics and menus are originally based on the rEFIt3project, which is reflected inthe directory name and in the Aboutmenu.

In the future, we call this cloverGUI program in general.

That is, the CLOVERX64.efi file should be at /EFI/CLOVER/, and the font BoG_LucidaConsole_10W_NA.png in thefolder /EFI/CLOVER/themes/black_green/.

A few words about the folder /EFI/CLOVER/OEM/

The folder is designed to store download options for different configurations. Typical situation when we create a boot drive, and on it in addition to the general confit

/EFI/CLOVER/config.plist, there are also well-calibrated /EFI/CLOVER/OEM/Inspiron 1525/ config.plist and /EFI/CLOVER/OEM/H61M-S1/UEFI/config.plist, as well as their developed DSDT.aml, different for different computers, and different sets of cupcakes.

The name of the folder is determined from SMBIOS and you canlook at the boot.log exactly what your computer is called:

0:100        0:000        Running on: 'Z170X-UD5 TH' with board 'Z170X-UD5  TH-CF'

In the first line the name of the entire system is characteristic of the presence of laptops, but on desktops there is something abstract. In the second line, the motherboard model is convenient for desktops, but not for laptops.

Even in your folder may contain a UEFI folder to have different confits for UEFI (option B) and for a legague download (option A) on one computer (although I personally doubt that someone needs it).

 

EFI Driver

Separately, I'll mention the drivers32, drivers64, drivers64UEFI, respectively, for 32, for 64bit  downloads  under  option  A  -  BIOS  boot,  and  for  UEFI  downloads  under  option  B. The composition of these folders  will be different for different bios audits, as well as for different configurationsof sections. Attention! the structure of the folders in the 5000 audit has changed, now it's one  folder,  with the embedded folders BIOS and UEFI. 32Bit is gone  forever.

It is worth noting that these drivers have power only for the duration of the loader. They do not affect the downloaded operating system, except indirectly, by the way the devices will be initiated (the fourth function of Clover).

What should you put in these folders?

-   NTFS.efi is the driver of the NTFS file    system,  for the ability to ship  Windows  EFI, however... it seems and is not needed especially, because the EFI-loader Vindous  also  lies in  ESP,  on  FAT32.

-   HFSPlus.efi is the driver of the HFS file system, which is required to launch MacOSX. It's necessary  for option B, but in A            it's  already present in the boot file.

-   VboxHFS.efi is a  legel  alternative  for  HFSPlus.efi,  is  slightly less fast.   Whereas HFSPlus.efi is just  hard-line.   That is, if the boot file has a built-in VboxHFS.efi, and in the  folder  drivers/BIOS / has HFSPlus.efi then the last one will  work.

-   VBoxExt2.efi is the driver of the EXT2/3 file system  needed  to launch Linux EFI. similar to  VboxExt4.efi. Again, if  Grub does not lie in the  EFI section.

-   Fat.efi is the driver of the FAT32 file system.  Of course, he's  already  there. However,  the AMI  UEFI  BIOS  contains a very  curved  driver,  so  I  preferred to ship  my  option.

-   FSInject.efi is a driver intercepting the file  system,  in order to be able to force the injection of some  cupcakes  into the  system,  if it does not consider it  necessary. Difficult  to understand?          

-   PartitionDxe.efi - actually, there is such a driver in CloverEFI, and in UEFI it is, but  only  it is not designed for Apple partition, nor on the hybrid  MBR/GPT. Conclusion:  in option B, you sometimes need a     driver.  

-   OsxFatBinaryDrv.efi is a  necessary driver for option B, ensures the launch of fat (Fat)  modules,  as is boot.efi in systems up to 10.9. In newer systems you can do without  it.

-   OsxAptioFixDrv.efi is  a special  driver designed to  correct  the  memory  card created by the AMI AptioEFI curve,  otherwise OS  cannot be launched.  

-   OsxAptioFix2Drv.efi is a slightly modified  version. With it was  possible  Hibernite  in the system  10.9.1  at  UEFI-loading! But,  unfortunately,    this  variationdoes not ship  10.7.5.

-   OsxAptioFix3Drv.efi -  a new  version,  adjusted  vit9696  to support the native NVRAM, can now  do  without  its  emulation!

-   AptioMemoryFix.efi is  a  completely redesigned driver from this series, authored by vit9696, with an additional automatic search for the  best slide'xxx value. At  the  moment it is recommended to  use  it    first  

-   OsxLowMemFix.efi is  a simplified  version of AptioFix,  suitable  for some strange variants of UEFI BIOS (Insyde  H2O).

-   These five Aptio variants will not be used at the same time, even if all are present,  Clover is choosing  one  of them on priority:  AptioMemoryFix,  OsxAptioFix3Drv.efi,  OsxAptioFix2Drv.efi,  OsxAptioFixDrv.efi  and,  last of all  OsxLowMemFix.efi.

-   For the new audit of Clover 5120, it is recommended that all of these drivers be  forgotten, and to use the amount of Oc'uyrksandOpenRuntime,  which are  now included in the Clover package,  and  starting  with  5122  Oc'uyrks is no  longer  needed,  it is contained  inside  Clover;

-   NvmExpressDxe, the  NvmExpress  controller  driver  positioned as a   replacement for SATA  for SSD drives, should be borne in mind that if the controller is on the motherboard, then  such a  driver  is  likely  already  available in UEFI BiOS.  

-   Usb'.efi, UHCI.efi, EHCI.efi, XHCI.efi, OHCI.efi - a set of USB drivers, for those cases of option B,  when  built-in drivers for some reason do not work well. Why  would  I?   There may be some kind of tie-up for other features that  have  had to be turned off.

-   PS2Mouse..., PS2MouseAbsolute..., UsbMouse... - a set of drivers to support the mouse/trackpad/touchpad in the CloverGUI interface.   In UEFI BIOS there is also  such a  driver,  do not interfere with  it.

-   AptioInputFix is  also for mouse and keyboard, if the UEFI bios version works cryduring. Written by  vit9696.

-   DataHubDxe.efi - this        driver  is  already present in option A, and it is possible to have it in UEFI.   There will be  no  conflict,  but there will be confidence thatit  is there. And they don't have  DataHubDxe!         Then they don't come to  me.  

-   CsmVideoDxe.efi       is a video driver that provides  a  larger screen size range than the UEFI built-in option if the graphics card doesn't have UEFI VideoBIOS.

-   GrubNTFS, GrubEXFAT,  GrubHFSPLUS, GrubUDF... -   a   set of drivers of a variety of file systems adapted from the sources of grub to work as part of Clover.   They have  some advantages over our drivers, for example GrubHFS  supports  compressed volumes,   but the status  of all  this  set is more likely  "beta." They are slow and buggy.   HFS - no link support,    UDF - not all hiders  reads,  EXFAT - no record (and so would like!).  

-   AppleImageCodec.efi is a  PNG decoder and BMP file, needed for  FileVault2.  

-   AppleKeyAggregator.efi creates a special  protocol  for  entering a password in the FileVault2  interface.

-   AppleUITheme.efi creates a  protocol  by which FileVault2  draws a background image of the screen (in Sierra, to theimer,  it is a blurred mountain).


-   AppleKeyFeeder.efi      is required  to  enter  a password in the FileVault2  interface  with a PS2 keyboard.

-   FirmwareVolume.efi creates the  FirmwareVolume  protocol, which is not  used  anywhere  but  FileVault2, which expects to find a cursor image there.  

-      SMCHelper.efi creates an  AppleSMCProtocol  protocol  that  would interact with the SMC chip and get information about the state of the   periphery from   there.     The content is filled by both Clover and FakeSMC,                          which retains   the  keys to NVRAM if FakeSMC stands with such a    feature.

-   HashServiceFix.efi creates HashService group protocols  if UEFI doesn't have them. FileVault2  interacts  with  them,    as can be seen from the  logs. But  I  didn't see any visual  effect.

-   APFS.efi is  the driver of the new  file  system, which appeared  at  10.13am. This  driver does not yet have an open analogue, so we use what is in the installed system from Apple on the way  /usr/standalone/i386/apfs.efi, or  →

-   ApfsDriverLoader is  an open  alternative to the APFS  driver. Thank you  savvas  and other members of the acidantheragroup. Its  essence  is to load the desired APFS driver simply from the container, so  always having the right version. However,  if we download the old  system, we get an old   driver, and   can't   read the APFS section with  the new system.

-   AudioDxe is  a sound driver developed by Goldfish64. It  can be used to play the  sound when you start your  computer. However, this decoration, if  such a sound is not           needed,   and without a driver can be burnedand. 

 

Download cupcakes

 

In the folder structure, we see a shared folder /EFI/CLOVER/kexts/ with folders 10.7/, 10.11/ and so on, as well as folders with the name Off/ and Others/.  Let's take a closer look at the issue.

Cupcakes are "Kernel Extensions" for the MacOSX operating system, most of them are drivers of some devices. Or a pseudo-daver of a non-existent device like FakeSMC. We download them becauseApple's clean sis theme just doesn't support our devices, or we want to introduce new functionality.

Starting with Audit 3281, all cupcakes are first downloaded from the Others/folder and then from a folder with a specific operating system number. AppleHDA, for example, in each system its own (I do not know, the truth, whether it is loaded with Clover). To me, so the meaning of only FakeSMC, the rest may be in the system itself, and even then, only at the time of installation, because  in the installer all the cupcakes are packed in cache, and there is impossible to slip something of your own (although... OpenCore seems to be able to do that). But since people want to ship all the cupcakes To Clover, let it be such an opportunity. Options:

First, if you're manually prescribing the menu (Custom → Entries), you can describe InjectKexts'Yes/No/Detectfor eachitem.

Secondly, there is a common setting for all

<key>SystemParameters</key>

<dict>

<key>InjectKexts</key>

<string>YES</string>

Detect is out of date and no longer used, and we always want to inject cupcakes.

Another moment. In the Captain there is an additional check on unsigned  cupcakes  to overcome it must be  turned off SIP (System Integrity Protection), it is done in the confit  in the key  CsrActiveConfig

<key>RtVariables</key>

<dict>

<key>CsrActiveConfig</key>

<string>0x3F7</string>

Plays the role of only a bit 0x1 (ALLOW_UNSIGNED_KEXTS) if you have unsigned  cupcakes. I've gotall the cupcakes  signed, and I can load it with  zero.

Starting with the 4233  audit,  Clover's    menu  was  able to  block the download of individual  cupcakes  from  folders  /EFI/CLOVER/kexts/z.   So  you  can  put a new, dubious  cupcake in there and try toload    it  up. And starting with the 5052 audit, you  can  put a dubious  cupcake     in the folder /EFI/CLOVER/kexts/Off/, for example  VoodooPS2  from Vasya Pupkin,  who  promises  that his cupcake is  better, the better you  have. When you download in Clover's menu, click on the Space,                  and          you see the menu to ban the cupcake inject.

Details

In order to compile the project, you still need a compiler, and libraries - an alphabetical truth. Framework? Environment? In Russian, I guess I have to say  LAST. It is downloaded from the same server. http://sourceforge.net/projects/edk2/

Since the entire project was created for Hakintosh and for Hakintosh' sake, the compilation of the project in the MacOSX environment is primarily considered. This, however, is not the only option Ihave. The built-in MacOSX tools are still not sufficient to compile the project, so it is suggested, as for Linux, to download and assemble a new version of  gcc using the script builgcc.sh in Clover's folder. Because Klang still doesn't give out workable codes.Thanks to zenith432, he finally made a workable compilation with Klan, so this text is being modified.

Starting with the modern version of 2.5k and in this there was a drastic change, the previous paragraph should be considered obsolete. All the necessary libraries of the environment are now included in Clover's composition, and its repository is complete for compilation, no external references are needed  anymore.

 

Writing codes

 

If there are those who wish, you can join the team of programmers, and offer your piece. We always go to meet, although we make certain requirements for codes. Initially, the project was made in the language C, formatted under the special rules of Tiano Code Style. https://github.com/tianocore/tianocore.github.io/wiki/Code-Style-C

However, with the transition to CJ, we do not want to use such a numberof macros, and we should consider using a standard programming style.

set of sources to build your project. But we're doing a real project, and we're setting our own rules, under powerful compilers and modern iron.

 

About CJ.

1.      By assembling structures and functions into logically unified classes, we simplify the code,  and make   it more visual.   Code  Reusing.

2.      You don't need to declare variables in advance, as the C. Variable language required,         where it is used.   Inthe measures, it's a cycle for (int i'0; i'lt;0; zom).                          

3.      Nightmares with Allocate/Free can be eliminated by using  the  automatic  memory control compiler  capabilities.

4.             To refuse to use arrays in favor of vectors.  

5.      Refusing to   copy  pointers  is  the  biggest  source of bugs in the  project. Although  it allows you to save something. Use links or  copy  structures    entirely.  

6.      Avoid retyping. Writing (INTN)N means logical error. If the N variable is used in an iconic  expression, that is,  which can become less than  zero, why has it  been  declared  unsigned? And  similar  to the types of pointers.   CJ does  not  encourage this type spoofing, and we  require that type swapping be used as rarely as possible.  

7.      More use constant variables and functions, that  is, indicate to the compiler  that their valuewillnot  be allowed,  the compiler  then  and the code  accordingly another will apply. And for a programmer breaking the ban there will be a warning.  

8.      We don't have a STL library, but  we create our own classes, andwe're all  sources  for  their use.

9.      Tiano Code Style implies the  use of  CONST,  VOID,  STATIC written in capital  letters. Why??? to make the language look more  like  a fortran, or what?! We tend to more standard writing  const, void, static,and so  on.

 

 

Compilation

Now to the  point. The reader who looked into this  chapter  can  not by definition be a simple user, and he does  not need to tell how to use the terminal.

1.     We download the sources. cd  ~

mkdir src

git clone --recurse-submodule https://github.com/CloverHackyColor/CloverBootloader.git  cd CloverBootloader

 

2.     We're collecting compilation tools


./buildgettext.sh

./build_gcc10.sh

./buildnasm.sh

However, you can not collect NASM yourself, but simply download the latest release from the official site of the http://www.nasm.us/pub/nasm/releasebuilds/, at the momentversion  2.15.05, and put in the folder of z/src/opt/local/bin/

If you forget any of this, then Clover's compilation script will do it for you.

3.     Collecting Clover is either partially or completely scripted

./buildme

asks you exactly what you want. Vector-sigma made a menu there with a choice from test build to full release.

 

 

Obsolete!

1.    

We download the sources and  prepare the  environment:

 

cd ~ mkdir src  cd  src

git clone https://github.com/tianocore/edk2 -b UDK2018 --depth 1 UDK2018 cd UDK2018

svn co svn://svn.code.sf.net/p/cloverefiboot/code/ Clover make -C BaseTools/Source/C

cd Clover

Or use a traditional EDK2. It continues to evolve its way, while Clover uses those functions that have long been made and adjusted, so it is enough to use UDK2018, but if you want, it is possible, with a specific revision, or with the latter, if it is known that it is working with Clover:

 

svn co -r 18198 https://svn.code.sf.net/p/edk2/code/trunk/edk2 edk2 svn co https://svn.code.sf.net/p/edk2/code/trunk/edk2 edk2

 

2.    

We assemble compilationtools

./buildgettext.sh

./buildgcc-4.9.sh

./buildnasm.sh

Now gcc is not particularly needed, Clover is perfectly compiled by the built-in clang, and Xcode you have to be installed anyway, so the compilation key -t XCODE8 is now the default key.

NASM needs  version  2.13.03 at least,    better than the newest,    in the  system  it  seems  to already  exist, but the old  version,  so  it should either  be  collected by the aforementioned  script,  or  just  download the finished release here:  http://www.nasm.us/pub/nasm/releasebuilds/

The correct version should be here

q/src/opt/local/bin/nasm or simple  /opt/local/bin/mkdir-p/opt/local/bin/

sudo cp ~/Downloads/nasm-2.13.03/nasm /opt/local/bin

 

Even to  compile the clan needs a    utility  MTOC,  it can be  assembled  by the most  of the latest  sources,

./buildmtoc.sh

or simply take a finished file that comes with Clover's source in the Clover/BuildTools/usr/local/bin/mtoc folder. NEW.zip

unpack, and put in /usr/local/bin/mtoc. NEW

Now it doesn't    come in if you  still  don't have it,  collect a version of the script, or borrow the finished version on the Internet. It    doesn't   need to    be updated.  

 

3.     We correct the EDK2 environment to our  needs by choosing appropriate  patches

Cd..

./edksetup.sh cd Clover

./buildgettext.sh

cp -R /Patches_for_UDK2018/* .. /

 

4.                

Now you can collect CloverEFI itself.  

./ebuild.sh

./ebuild.sh -mc --no-usb

./ebuild.sh -ia32

The default is now -x64 and --xcode8, if there is a desire to compile with gcc, then

./ebuild.sh -gcc49

or even -gcc53, or -t XCODE5

Other compilation scripts, usually self-documented, have also been created. Look, choose, use.

5.     One subtlety. The repository does not have HFSPlus.efi files for 32 and 64  bits, due to their privacy.   This  driver is workable, but a little  slower.


Was

# foreign file system support #INF                Clover/VBoxFsDxe/VBoxHfs.inf

INF      RuleOverride=BINARY  Clover/HFSPlus/HFSPlus.inf


Do (now so done insilence)

# foreign file system support INF             Clover/VBoxFsDxe/VBoxHfs.inf


#INF       RuleOverride=BINARY  Clover/HFSPlus/HFSPlus.inf

6.     Similarly, there is no  apfs.efi,  but  there is no analogue,   you need to  take  from the system  10.13 from the folder  usr/stanadlone/i386/apfs.efi, or use  ApfsDriverLoader.efi

7.          The project does not stand still, so this instruction may  eventually be inoperable due to some small    change.  

8.     Now we're assembling an installer.

 

cd ~/src/edk2/Clover/CloverPackage/

./makepkg


./makeiso

 

It's done! Some steps could be lowered if you do for yourself and not for the first time. For example, instead of downloading the entire project, do simply an update svn up or better ./update.sh (including an EDK2 update, but not needed for UDK2018), eliminate a 32-bit compilation, and not collect a package and an image of the disk.

Full-automated CloverGrower scripts and its Pro version are prepared for teapots.  The script  to  help the kettle itself compile  the  package. The kettle is better to  download  the finished  installer.

Nb! A new LinkTimeOptimization compilation method has been introduced in the 3000 audits, significantly reducing the size of the code. Compiler gcc-4.8 without it, 4.9 with it.

Size without it 675520, with optimization 633536, and works the same way, only faster.

You don't have to do that for a klang.

Since the audit, 3059 has been able to reduce the size and file boot (CloverEFI) by shifting the Translation Page Table from 0x90,000 to 0x88000, The file size was483KB, became 450KB, and in doing so it was more secure to work on some chip sets.

Compilation withcconfe

./ebuild.sh --low-ebda

Now this key is the default to undo, you need a key -std-ebda.

It is also interesting for developers to know where the letter "B" or "6" is formed, which is displayed on the screen at the start of CloverEFI. The 6x3 editing editor is looking for a 0x02a9 offset, there and seeing a byte of 0x42 or 0x36 respectively. By the way, undo this letter is nota use, because it is a trick to Clover at all to start. BIOS produces the initialization of the video adapter at this point.

 

Making a DEBUG version of Clover

When people complain that Clover isn't running, and sothey can't pre-report, I can't help but a couple of standard tips.

Option 1. . 

1.      The start-up sector st32_64.s. It is  the output of this very number 6, the removalof theBIOS memory card, switching the A20, and switching the processor from 16 bits to 32 and 64. My  version of the sector  differs  from  the vanilla  theme  that  works  on a laptop. It  is possible that for  someone  and here  there will be       problems.

2.      Start codes  S. File efi32.s or efi64.s. Here hardly anything  can  slow down.

3.      File Efiloader.c. Here  you can  insert  output  onto the  screen  using    the PrintHeader('A') procedure; which    is currently  commented on.

4.      File DxeIpl/DxeInit.c. You can also  insert PrintHeader, but also include Debug.c in the compilation of  this  module.

5.      DxeCore. Here the execution is already  sprawling, and to track  where and what  is more  difficult. You  can do the  same.  

6.      CLOVERX64 itself. EFI  is downloaded  in   the BdsBoot.c/BdsLibBootViaBootOption    ().      

Option 2. The blow itself works that you can check by clicking the space wedazu after output 6 on the screen.

The standard method of Boot---debug'true is not satisfied, because you need to trace the place in more detail.

In thisincident, we take a comment in the 11th line in the Platform.h file

#define DEBUG_ALL 2

or put DEBUG_xxx 2 in the files of interest in the top lines. At the same time, the entire withdrawal from the DBG team ("Nightmare No.3)); will go to the screen. And in this way, you can interactively observeto what place the program will be performed before it hangs.

It's a good place to be. Don't use Russian letters, as I illustrated here! With the transition to CJ, Russian letters can be used in debage

Option 3. Compileethe debage version with stop points, run under the control of zEMU with a special gdb installed.

Option4. When compilinga ./ebuild.sh -D DEBUG_ON_SERIAL_PORT  

and connect another computer to the serial port that can take letters to a serial port (terminal in winds). The option works on zEMU if you start to specify the "-serial stdio" flag

 

Installation

Usingan installer

What is  the installer for? Why do it manually, the installer will do everything more accurately than you do! The only condition that you already have MacOSX on this                  computer. The installation DVD was launched  with another  downloader,  and the installation interface of MacOSX  was  launched. 


 

So

We follow the Keys Continue and OK, read and agree with the license agreements (hmm, and they are there?), and come to choose what we set, where and why.

 

Change Install Location - the choice of where to put the loader. MacHDD in  this  sample. And tick on "Install Clover in the ESP."      

Customize or Standard Install - a choice of download options

Ifyou put a cursor on one of the lines, there will be a brief description of this option in the bottom field.

Install Clover only for UEFI downloads - this option cancels the installation  of bootfiles.

People, for God's sake, don't tick this box, even if you havea computer with UEFI BIOS.

Install Clover in the ESP                                (Install  Clover on EFI SECTION ESP) is the best  option  when  there  is such a  section  (GPT section scheme).    

"automatic update program").

Before installation should be dismantled section ESP.

sudo mount -uw /

that will allow scripts to write files into system folders.

If the system writes that the installer cannot be opened because its author is an unidentified developer, you can go to the system settings, Security, and press the "Still Open" button. Or you can command in the terminal

sudo spctl --master-disable

However, it is not my business to teach you the tricks of using macos.

Bootloader is a variant with BIOS (option A) that uses CloverEFI, or with UEFI (option B).

-          Don't update MBR and PBR sectors - don't update  sectors because they  already  exist, or just for option B;

-          Install boot0af in MBR - boot0af download,  i.e. Search for an active section. The installer  will make the selected  section  active. The exception  is the installation on the EFI section, it is not made  active, and boot0af without finding an active section  will ship the boot file from the EFI section, what we need to make a boot from the GPT disk, from the ESP section.

-          Install boot0ss in MBR - boot0ss download,  i.e. Search for  the HFS section, even if it's inactive.  

Use Alternative Booting PBR (Use PBR withdownload load)  - as stated in the chapter "What is what", the PBR sector can be with a pause of 2 seconds to press 1-9,  or without it. This item is no longer in the installer ;)

CloverEFI is, as can be seen from the downloader's list,thechoice of loader  bits.  And, as a rule, works with any controller (BIOS should work with them!). 

Drivers. . . the choice of drivers is explained above in the chapter "What is what."

Install system scripts RC on the main section - These are scripts rc.local and rc.shutdown.local, which are executed by the OSX system at the entrance and exit - a necessary part of the entire legosy-Clover concept.

Install scripts on all other sections - if the computer has more than one section with MacOSX.

Install the Clover control panel - this control panel  helps Clover update, select the theme, and install NVRAM variables.

 

Installing the loader manually

It is necessary in twocases: when catching fleas and in diarrhea. First, when a person knows well what he is doing, and wants to control every step, not believing the installer (and in vain!), and,

secondly, when installed from under another OS, where the installer is not possible to start.

Osx

It is not recommended to do this to someone who does not know what the terminal is.

Installing on the HFS section in MBR or hybrid breakdown. WhyMBR? Is it a very standard situation  where the computer  already  exists,  and  already with the information, nothing to lose, you can  only put a new loader.

 

Installation of the MBR sector

cd BootSectors


sudo fdisk440 -f boot0 -u -y /dev/rdisk0

What's on this team?

fdisk440 is a special version of the fdisk utility, adjusted to use  only  440 bytes of the zero  sector, there is information that it is  necessary for compatibility with Windows (wake-up problem), which Apple did not take care of.

boot0 - file described above in the  chapter  "What is  what"

rdisk0 is a physical device, andyou're going to put a loader on it.

These files come with Clover. The new version of fdisk440 is excluded, primarily because of the inability to compile it in the new environment. Now we use dd instead, as shown for Linux.

 

Installation of the PBR sector


sudo dd if=boot1h2 of=/dev/rdisk0s9

boot1h2 is a PBR sector file for the HFS file system, differs from similar support for large boot files, and the ability to select boot1.3.6 on the hot key. Details in the chapter "What is what."

rdisk0s9 is the ninth section on your chosen device... Why the nines?         And you need to put a real figure, for example, the first section.

And after the MBR and PBR sectors are successfully recorded on the selected device/selected section, this section should be made active fdisk440 -e /dev/rdisk0

>f 9

>w


>q

Nine in the second line is again the section number (there are only four!) - make aconclusion.

 

Installation on the FAT32 section.


Unlike the previous method, there is one subtlety. The PBR sector should contain the geometry of the section. This information is entered there in the process ofp-binging into sections, so the loss of such information is fraught with consequences.

dd if=/dev/rdisk1s9 count=1 bs=512 of=origbs cp boot1f32alt newbs

dd if=origbs of=newbs skip=3 seek=3 bs=1 count=87 conv=notrunc dd if=newbs of=/dev/rdisk1s9 count=1 bs=512

 

boot1f32alt - already mentioned in the chapter "What is what" - the sector to install on the section FAT32. But not FAT16! Be careful!

rdisk1s9 - again the ninth section on the first device. 

The rest of the action is similar to that of the HFS.

For owners of hard drives with a sector size of 4k.

In the first and fourth command, instead of bs'512, you have to write bs'4096.

It's a good place to be. However... that's not a fact! I've got a 4k drive with a perfect setup with 512.

 

Installation on exFAT section

Starting with the audit of 3040, it was possible to install Clover on the fold ofexFAT format.

./boot1-install -u -y /dev/disk2s1

In principle, the company has made both HFS and FAT32 installed by this utility. It is important that the relevant sectors (boot1h, boot1f32, boot1x) lie in the same folder. For EXFAT, the sector is called boot1x. Option with pawboot1xalt.

 

There is, however, another point when installing these sectors. Tom, where you want to install the sector, you need to pre-install! And this is only possible if the disk is not systemic.

Linux

There is also a terminal under the Linux, and almost the same commands, but installation is only possible on FAT32. The differences are as follows.

-          instead of rdisk1 will be  sdb - look in your version of Linux more precisely.

-         

instead of fdisk440 to record MBR, you need to use The Same Dd

 

Windows

From under Windows it also makes sense to put the loader only  on the flash drive  FAT32,  it  is enough to run the script


makeusb.bat E:

where E: is the letter of your flash drive. It's Not supposed to be a few sections.

All the files required for the script are attached complete with Clover. However, the installer must be pre-unpacked or receive these files directly from svn. They are in the folder edk2/Clover/CloverPackage/CloverV2/BootSectors

After running the script, the flash drive needs to be removed and re-pasted, then copy the boot file and the EFI folder to it.

It's even better to use BootDiskUtility.exe by Cvad to help you build a Flash drive from under Windows.

http://www.applelife.ru/threads/delaem-zagruzochnuju-clover-fleshku-s-macosx-iz-windows.37189/

<string>0/Min/Max/some number</string>

The number can be found in your boot.log, or put Max - will be the maximum possible resolution.

contents of the folder. If there's a theme.plist, it's a melting topic. If there is a theme.svg, then it is a vector theme.

<key>EmbeddedThemeType</key>

<string>DayTime</string>

Possible Dark  and Light options.   Introduced  with an audit of  4644. Options  were invented before the  invention of the watch,  you  could  choose  dark  or  light  embedded  themes. And  now by the hour, the day is light, at night dark. 

<key>Timezone</key>

<integer>3</integer>

Clover's modern audit, 4773, introduced the concept of "time of day." When you start Clover reads the current time from BIOS, it usually stands at greenwich, and adds to it the value of this setting, zone. if it's between  8:00 and 8:00 p.m., it's considered a daysound_night.wav.wav or anight.

<key>PlayAsync</key>

<false/>

Beginning with the 4833 audit, there was a sound in Clover with the presence of the audioDxe.efi driver, the author of Goldfish64, notgoing to deal with Clover, well, well, he is not against the use of his solutions. PlayAsync determines whether the sound plays in sync with Clover's work, or asynchronous. That is, when synchronized playback nothing works until the sound is over. When assinechronic sound flows regardless of what is happening on the screen. Scan entries... then the Clover interface appears, the sound continues, then the lines of the boot.efi work, the sound continues, thenthe sound runs, and the cupcake.wav s are started in turn.

Clover 4862 had a bug,  asynchronous  sound hung computer.   Starting with 4870,  there are no problems, you can put PlayAsync'true.

<key>CustomIcons</key>

<false/>

If you put it in the zlt'true,you'll search for an icon for each section with the operating system. VolumeIcon.icns  at the root of the section and used instead of icons set by the theme.

<key>ScreenResolution</key>

you can set the desired screen resolution, more than the standard 1024 x768, if the parameters of the graphics card and the screen itself have such a mode. Clover tries to put the greatest possible resolution, however, he may be mistaken. Check the list of available booth-log modes.

If patchVBios'Yes is in the graphics section, you will have the maximum resolution available for this monitor. In this case, ScreenResolution may be superfluous. With some configurations, the PatchVBios option can be fatal - a black screen with no signs of life.

There's a subtlety here. Clover should be known for the EDID monitor. Lega being a Clover trying to get it through the calls of INT10 BIOS, often successfully, sometimes not. UEFY Clover asks UEFI BIOS, who probably knows EDID for the built-in graphics card, and probably doesn't know for insert.log ed.

<string>MetalBack.png</string>

<string>0x80</string>

<key>Dark</key>

<true/>

</dict>

Path  sets the name     ofthe file (or rather the path!) in  which  the background image ison the entire screen.

Type

Crop is to trim a large image to the size of the screen, or fill in the background.

Tile - to pave the mosaic of tiles.

Scale - stretch proportionally so that the image takes the entire screen and more, under thestrum.

In ordinary stretching, square pixels are produced, so usually some smoothing is used, however, such smoothing spoils the edges.

In Clover made a detector of edges, its value is determined by the parameter

Sharp

If 0 is not a detector, the edges are blurred. The maximum value of 0xFF is 255 - there is no blur. 0x80 - creates some intelligent blur with sharp edges. Also paired with it works option

Dark

If it is implied that you have a dark image with white lines, itis a light image with dark lines.

The following agreements (blackosx) have been adopted for font names

BoG - Black On Gray - black on a graybackground. LucidaConsole is  the name of the original font. 10W  - letter width

NA - No Antialiasing.

The size of one character in the 16 pixel file, however, the characters themselves take up less space, so the following parameter indicates the optimal width, and this, again, depends on the author's design.

Proportional - Starting with the revision of 3217, it has been possible to use proportional fonts.

Alittle more space than m. Mono-shirini font is,  for example,  a Courier,proportional to the Times.   However,  Clover  is able to compact  and  mono-wide  fonts,  but  still,  the  result will be better with specially prepared. Here,  for example, is a  picture

compare the width of the letters i and m.

CharWidth 10 - you can use the width recommended by the author of the  font, and you can change to your own way. 9 - thicker,  11  - cut.

Starting with the 3537 revision, this option affects the width of the text in Options Menu, because it always has a Proportional'false, and the width of the letters is entirely determined by this parameter, and in the line of information the text is proportional, and is compressed in fact for each letter, even if the matrix is much wider.

<key>Badges</key>

Badzik is a small drawing in the bottom right corner of the main picture. It was originally conceived that the main icon depicts a disk (as in a bootcamp), and badjik tells what operating system there is.

Show - Whether to show the badge.

Swap - to change the meaning of the icon and badge.

Inline - show the badge in a line with information about the chosen icon.

OffsetX and  OffsetY - the badjik offset from the top left corner.

Scale is the size of a badge in X/16 units from the original size (example 7/16). That  is, in a standard theme the size of 48 pixels, which corresponds to 6/16  of the standard  icon.

1-10 is a list of existing sub-settings.

That is, on this screen will be animated Leo, if given ID 37

 

 

Path -  ML_Anim  - Animation Title,    identifies the name of a folder  in  which individual frames with names lie 

ML_Anim_000.png ML_Anim_001.png ML_Anim_008.png ML_Anim_014.png

In the case of missed frames, the last acting one will be used,  i.e.   002-007  will be           framed 001, and as 009-013 - frame 008.     

Frames - 15 - the total number of frames in the animation.

FrameTime - 100 - a time interval between frames in ms. Variable interval is realized with the help of missed frames.

Once - if you specify the animation will be played only once, before leaving the main menu (clicking the right mouse key into the milk on the main screen, or the Escape key).

ScreenEdgeX - horizontal report point (left/right/centre)

DistanceFromScreenEdgeX  - the position of the film relative to the point of the report, as a percentage of the size of the screen.

NudgeX - 1% - is a lot, for the screen 1920 will already be 19 pixels, so in this option we do refinement in pixel units.

Vector themes

Why it's needed

The decision to create a design of Clover's GUI based on vector graphics arose from one user's complaint that you pray to run with the same flash drive on different  computers,  on  one  small screen, and  then a large theme just does not  fit, and on  the other a huge screen, and  then  theusual theme looks too small,  and the text @2x is generally unreadable. That  is, in           Clover's  confit is the theme of metal, and     depending on the resolution of the monitor loads either metal or  metal@2x.

Then I decided to make a really scalable theme based on vector graphics.        has avery specific size in pixels, and you can write an instruction to qlt'"circle cx"100" cy""200" r"50"gt; and instruct the drawing program to make a circle on the screen with this position and such a  radius in abstractunits,  which will be  recalculated to the right number of pixels depending on   the size of the screen. 

You can't make a good design on the circles and squares, so you need some standard vector graphics with a large number of features. A clover-type open project certainly requires an open standard, well-documented, and supported by drawing programs. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalable_Vector_Graphics

Now the next question, how do I make her support? It is necessary to interpret these commands, and to draw something appropriate, to put it mildly is not an easy task. And then I find the nanosvg project, https://github.com/memononen/nanosvg

It is ospensor, allows you to copy to itself, it contains only two files in the language C, that is, you can use almost unchanged. The author stopped the development, despite manysuggestions for improvement, like done like this, use it as it is.I've yet to make them possible within the capabilities of EDK2.

But the theory without practice is dead, I can't do support topics unless I have a sample of such. Let the whole theme be a single file with thename theme.svg that any viewer, such as GoogleChrome, Safari, or just by the space of the zuickLook, Clover will look like Clover's interface.      

Thetheme's style means that on a screen of any size the interface will look the same, the icons will take up the same percentage of the screen size, in the sense of the width of the theme is not scaled, in favor of saving squares.

Vector themes still have an advantage in using fonts. There was only one font in the thread theme, somehow made proportional or not, whereas in the vector it can be several different fonts, really proportional, and very smooth. 

Although yes, I understand, those who put Timeout 0, or TextOnly, or embedded, this chapter is not interesting at all.

 

How to make a vector theme

First, you need to put a drawing program in which  you  will be  comfortable to draw, and  which  can  export  this drawing in the  SVG format version 1.1. Although  with  some improvements compared to this standard.     My  brief review

1.      Adobe Illustrator . version    the higherthe better. 

2.      Inkscape. Advantage Number 1 is  its  freeness, and accordingly the legality. SVG  is its  native  format,  but it still has a number of its SVG extensions that  are not supported by anyone else. Hooray! Version 1.0 now runs in makos from 10.11 to  10.15!

3.      LibreOffice Draw. It's also freeand         legal.

4.      CorelDraw.Just don't know, didn't  enjoy it.

5.            BoxySVG.allowing you  to create  and edit  individual  SVG  drawings,  and  immediately  control  the code    created,    unlike  older brethren  who will form  the code  only  at the  final  export.  Other programs  will not consider, at your discretion,  only follow the standard version 1.1, and the recommendations  below.

Secondly, the theme drawing.svg should consist of quite certain components with quite certain names, as Clover chooses from there drawings by names. Full list:

Background, Banner, selection_big, selection_small, selection_indicator, pointer, scrollbar_background, scrollbar_holder, checkbox, checkbox_checked, radio_button, radio_button_selected,

by some error the scrollbar was defined with a minus instead of emphasizing, because so in the rastra tems, in the vector corrected.

vol_internal_ext3 - disk section with EXT file system; vol_recovery  -   Recovery,  RecoveryHD and other Operating System Icons

Second-row service icons

tool_shell, func_clover, func_options, func_about, func_reset and  func_shutdown,and

func_help thatis displayed when calling for help on F1.

Third, the location of these icons inside the theme file.svg plays a role for previews, but not for Clover himself. With the exception of Banner. this is a central picture, and it is not just located in a fixed place in the center of the screen, as it was in the rastra themes, the banner is now located onthe screen as intended in thesubject.

Another point, all sorts of boottons and scrolls in general are not needed for previews, as well as numerous icons of axes and discs, so they should be hidden from previews, but left available to Clover. It helps to attribut visibility"hidden, which, however, Clover will ignore when he needs to draw this icon on the screen.

Vector themes support the new "night design" feature.

The built-in clock will tell Clover how much  time it is, recalculate them       locally, and the time from 8:00 to 20:00 is considered day and the rest   of _night the night.

For example os_mac pointer_night, in addition to the main banner with the name "Banner" you can draw a second picture with the name "os_mac_night Banner_night."

completely different. So we have actually two different themes in one, oneand displayed by day, the second night.

Each icon, in addition, must contain an invisible rectangle that defines its boundaries. The reason is simple, the icon may have content smaller than its size, and Clover should know its full size, which should bemasked BoundingRect_.

Example.

<g id="tool_shell" transform="translate(300, 600)">

<rect visibility="hidden" id="BoundingRect_ts" y="0" width="64" height="64"/>

<g transform="matrix(0.55 0 0 0.55 15 10)">

<use xlink:href="#knopka"                      width="85.5" height="85.5"  />

</g>

<g transform="matrix(0.55 0 0 0.55 25 43)">

<text class="st35 st36 st38 st39">$_</text>

</g>

</g>

Decipher word by word.

<g ... It's a group of images that make up one total. Her name is "tool_shell," which Clover uses to paint The Shell icon in the second row. transform""translate (300, 600)"  - sets the icon shift on previews. Clover ignores.

The second line is the second line of the "lt.rect.. This is the same service invisible rectangle that sets the size of the icon, in our case 64 x64. A pixel unit, compared to the size of the theme itself, which is 1600x900. Accordingly, the 1800-high screen will have a 128 x128, for example.

In the third line again there is a combination of images, and the general transformation: the size in relation to the above boundaries, and the shift within them. The fact that in the graphics editor you are comfortable to draw on another scale, but then you need to bringthe m ashtab of individual icons to the scale of the whole theme.

Use                         xlink:href"#knopka"      width""85.5" height""85.5" / zgt; - this in         the  original     project nanosvg was not, and in general it is probably from SVG2.0 - support of symbols.   I     just use    the.svg  same  picture.  

With the transformation in the Luster trouble, probably as in other vector editors. It is a sharp recount of thecoordinates of all the internal objects of the image, instead of leaving the attribute of transformation outside the group.

 

SVG inClover

Far from ideal. But we can see that very much done by the Illustrator works as expected.

The figuresare : zlt'rect'gt;

The figures can be grouped together in groups and in the simvof the ola.

association can contain a name and transformation.

The group is a static association, as defined, anddisplayed.

This defines a group of shapes that together create vol_internal an image of an internal disk. Within this group, the obligatory element of the "BoundingRect_001" class""st0" width"128" height"128"/"gt;" It is needed to redo the group sizes, inorder for Clover to position this image correctly, because the inner drawings are likely to be smaller than the overall size.

The symbol is a dynamic merging. Browsers will not show the characters identified in the theme, this set of objects is a blank for use by other objects.

Used it will be the operator of the example:

<symbol id="HDIconBase" viewBox="-64 -64 128 128">

z"/>

/>

Drawing this figure inside the icon

 

<g id="osx_moj">
