xlink:href is a link and points to a symbol called HDIconBase.

Unlike the SVG standard, Clover doesn't understand the references to bands, only to symbols. Alas and ah, but this should be taken into account, creating your own design. That is, transfer the group to the symbol, and make a reference to this symbol.

Fills and  strokes.  

About the bypass to can not say anythingconcrete.               

A simple option  is a homogeneous  veto  pour. The color  is given by 16-year-old RGB constants:  fill: "#ffcc00" is orange.   There are also valid numbers and percentages. 

Above the standard in Clover color names: fill:"white" and many more names, I will not copy a hundred words. Use SVG standard, and if anything,  see  Clover's source.

Another type of pouring is gradients.

linearGradient - there's 100% match to the mouth.

radialGradient - unfortunately, there is no focus point  yet, so the radial gradient in Clover  may not look quite as laid out in the design. conicGradient  - this is not in the standard (yet?).                   

And how can I not support if my Metal theme is created on the tapex gradienents?! Another question, how did I draw it then? In Photoshop, he can do it.not by radius, but by angle, counting the angle, it's stop"0.0" and the 360 angle is stop"1.0."

       For the design  you can  make  a radial  gradient,  and  then the text  editor  to turn  it   into a conical. 

Dithering.And this is also not in the standard, although,in myeye, begs. there will be no intermediates, but there will be no intermediate values (noticeably on the Clovy theme of the backfield with circlesin the earlyvers and the Clover, without the support of dithering).

The standard does not have a sample syntaxand for this case, so developed his.

Code:

<radialGradient clover:ditherCoarse="16"                                  id="GrayRadialBackground_5_" cx="441.2867" cy="0.7502" r="1.0023" gradientTransform="matrix(5.400000e-14 768 -874.24  4.700000e-14

1338.8547 -338690.875)" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse">

<stop        offset="0"  style="stop-color:#7C7C7C"/>

<stop        offset="1"  style="stop-color:#5E5E5E"/>

</radialGradient>

The digital parameter coarse - roughness, determines the length of viewing points, between what and what to choose. For large drawings, as background, picked up a value of 16.

There's enough for theicons, and it looks very smooth and almost imperceptible.

Illustrations later, however, they were laid out on a sleigh at different times.

 

Filling with a pattern (pattern)

               Here we are very far  from full-time. 

The pattern     is  a  PNG  image,  and  it  fills the desired  path  on the scale to completely fill it   with    it.

Why do you need it? The fact is that many of Apple's logos are photos, that is, rastre, and we have options: vectorize the stretch (not too beautifulabout), draw something completely different, or turn the rastra into the vector.

In The Illustrator, there is such a function

1.     We include the PNG drawing in the design.  (embed).

2.     We translate the shape into a pattern

3.     In the properties of the filled figure, we specify to fill in a pattern with such-and-such ID. The only problem is that the picture does  not  multiply,  as it should be according to  the  specification, and fills the entire space with scaling in the size of the  canvas.

Oh yes, still a limitation

<pattern id="pattern_1234". . >

Clover's pattern ID is required to include the word pattern, otherwise Clover has no way of understanding what we're filling a shape with. However, the use of built-in PNG doesn't make much sense, in which case it was better to do just a PNG theme.

 

Clips (clipPath)

Unlike   the original nanosvg project, I have clips supported, but  the algorithm is notmine, but taken from the    pool-requeste. I do not know how it   works,    and  how  adequate.  In general, you can use, but carefully.

 

Texts and SriLanka

In the original nanosvg project, this feature is              missing,  but Clover without text is unthinkable, so I did.     I  don't  even remember  about  other  vector  editors, for everyone one way or another the  problem.

There's a set of rules for Clover's vector theme.

1.       You can use  multiple  fonts,  while  there's only one in the spread themes.   One of them, the main one, should be included in the theme file itself.svg. You can  turn everything on,just the file will swell.svg in size. However,  at the same time,  we will lose the differences in fonts. That  is, Clover will see all the fonts, Safari  only  built-in, and Chrome will not see any.  

2.       At this point,  it's  possible  to identify  three  text  styles  (font,  size,  and  color): for options menu, help and about screens, and for messages at the bottom of the screen, the same style is headlined. Maybe  in the future we will expand the use of styles.

<g id="MenuRows" class="st0"><text class="st1">Menu</text></g>

<g id="HelpRows" class="st0"><text class="st2">Help</text></g>

  Here st1, st2, st3 classes should define text styles, and the st0 class should simply hide unnecessary text from previews.

As we can see, everything is standard here, just a different purpose. Here we write the text only to mark the styles. And Clover himself will find something to write these styles, by id group, that is, for the menu "MenuRows" and for help on F1 "HelpRows".

 

3.       But in general, in icons  you can use  text as an element of decoration. You can  use any  font,  but make  it  built-in, and  maybe  embed this font with the option "only used glyph" - that is not the entire  font,  which on average weighs 500kb, and Chinese and all  30Mb, but  only used in  the icon letters.

Moreover,  you can apply transformations to the text:  turn, tilt,    etc. You can  do a stroke without pouring,  the letters will be  "white" - I do not remember what it is called, in the wind of  such  style  is not,  in The Mac is, and with  moh-old years.

Unlike the standard, there is no textPath - the location of the text along the line, for example, around the perimeter of the circle. Maybe someday...

The size of the text is set in pixels. That is .st8'font-size:16px; but it's in the size of the theme design. Inthe work, the theme will be scaled in the size of the monitor, along with

letter sizes. Thus, for the theme in the design of 1366 x768 normally looks text with the size of 12rh, on the monitor with a vertical 2144 it will be almost 36rh.

 

4.       Ineed a  font  containing special unicode symbols for design. For example,  ⌘. This  typeface I found, it occupies 30MB,  where do I   take       it?  The illustrator seeing an unfamiliar font replaces  it with his own, and kills everything I've done in my  subject....

The first rule used is the  font  to  be  installed in the  system,    not  just in the  theme. So  that's what    I  call it.

its built-in Font ArialMT,  Helvetica and  the  like, inserting  there  glyphs from the font I want, the illustrator shows incorrectly,  because  the other font, but at least does not  kill. Kvikluk shows correctly and I can handle bymoving  the letters to where they need to be.

I still have inscriptions right on the icons. I just did this as an illustrator,  his font, and pointed out the export font "used only glyphs."           So, we have to introduce a text containing all english letters, numbers and punctuation in the original design of the theme.    Like,  

<text class="st1">ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ...

And so on. Then the Illustrator when importing the theme will not forget about all these symbols. So put this text in an invisible group.

5.       Once    you  use  the Illustrator  and  ask  him  to implement  SVG  fonts, only used fonts, or whatever,  then you should check that   he's a snr with it.  

Here, for example, is the code:

<font horiz-adv-x="2048">

<!-- Helvetica is a registered trademark of Linotype AG -->

<!-- Copyright: Copyright 2018 Adobe System Incorporated. All rights reserved. -->

<font-face font-family="MyriadPro-Regular" units-per-em="2048" underline-position="-155" underline-thickness="101"/>

<missing-glyph horiz-adv-x="1298" />

<glyph unicode=" " horiz-adv-x="569"/>

<glyph unicode="E" horiz-adv-x="1366" d="M175,1469l1071,0l0,-180l-877,0l0,-446l811,0l0,- 170l-811,0l0,-498l892,0l0,-175l-1086,0z"/>

<glyph unicode="H" d="M161,1469l201,0l0,-607l764,0l0,607l201,0l0,-1469l-201,0l0,687l- 764,0l0,-687l-201,0z"/>

First, there is no bbox in the font-face element" and it is strictly necessary, look for what should be there, fit in with your hands.

Secondly, scroll through the entire list so that each glyph has an attribut horiz-adv-x"", it determines the width of the letter, that is, where you can draw the next one.

There is a default, but itdoes not always correspond to the real width of the letter, as a result such a letter will attack the neighbor.

In this example, this attibut is missing from the letter H, and its real value is 1479, which is not obvious. You can take from the letter about the same width, and you can nthe ute series of experiments to do a little more, or a little less.

 

Subject attributes

Clover needs his add-ons compared to the standard, and this is done in its namespace. To do this, the top of the file is added

xmlns:clover="https://sourceforge.net/projects/cloverefiboot"

It's a legitimate operation. After that, we can add notlegitimate things, but with the prefix clover: as above did with Dithering.

Another example of conical gradients is a deviation from the standard, so we had to introduce an additional attribute that is acceptable standard, but indicating to Clover that you need to act outside the box.

<radialGradient clover:conic="1" id="knopkaUp" cx="14142.7324" cy="-40300.8711" r="37.5003" gradientTransform="matrix(-0.706 -0.7082 0.7082 -0.706 38525.8438 -

18436.5312)" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse">

<stop        offset="0"               style="stop-color:#FFF8D4"/>

<stop        offset="0.1"  style="stop-color:#EEE0B4"/>

<stop        offset="0.5"  style="stop-color:#161616"/>

<stop        offset="0.9"  style="stop-color:#EEE0B4"/>

<stop        offset="1"               style="stop-color:#FFF8D4"/>

</radialGradient>

It describes the radial gradient, and this is how it will be understood by other people's programs. But Clover will interpret itas a conical gradient.

And now the general theme settings

Fixing the hardware

Create a config.plist file

Actually, Clover does the configuration automatically. But the machine is never perfect, so the user has the ability to change different settings through the config.plist file, or just in the Options menu when working in theGUI e. Do you think you'll set up the settings better than the machine?

This is an xml file, however, and it's convenient to treat it as a text file at the moment. .app You can edit this file by text editor or a specialized program like PlistEditor or Xcode, if there is one.

<key>#SuspendOverride</key>

<false/>

Lattice means that  this  key is excluded from the con figs altogether.  Clover uses the default setting.

<key>GUI</key>

<dict>

<key>#Custom</key>

<dict>

And here the whole section of Custom is excluded.

 

The general rule is, if you don't know what value to give to a setting, exclude it altogether from the file, or put it on the file. Don't leave the option uns paralysed! And even more so, do not put the value, which do not understand!

 

It offers adredged version of making such a confit for your computer:

–        Install the default model file, with only  safe settings.

–        load into Clover's graphics shell and go to the Options menu (there's a button in the lower  ppoison, or just on the "O") key;

–        keys up/down/enter/escape  to walk around the  entire  menu,  and try to understand what they write  and    why;

–        that understandably correct, incomprehensible leave as is.

–        load into the system. If you failed, we repeat the operation, but  already changing the parameters, to the complete  success.

Entering the system, we go to the terminal, and recruit a team

cd ~/App/clover-genconfig >config.plist

Assuming you've pre-put the genconfig utility in the folder. In this way, you'll get an almost complete config.plist with your most successful settings with which you managed to load.

Attention! The clover-genconfig utility depends onclover's roar!

Since the 5100 audits, we have a Clover program.app that has the same genconfig function, and this utility is now excluded.

A little more handmade for complete perfectionism. Below is a description of the settings of the confit.

All options are combined by groups: ACPI, Boot, CPU, Devices, DisableDrivers, GUI, Graphics, KernelAndKextPatches, RtVariables, SystemParameters, SMBIOS, BootGraphics.

 

Boot

<key>Timeout</key>

<integer>5</integer>

If the loader entered the GUI and paused for 5 seconds before the startof the system bydefault.

-1 (minus one) - the loader is included in the menu, does not attempt to start.

A pause of 25 seconds in the default confit is made to make the user admire animation. The countdown and autostart only occurs if the correct DefaultVolume is set, and not the onein the default confit.

The timeout doesn't work unless NVRAM defines the default system. Go to the system, the DownloadD'S System, and reboot it.

The Timeout'0 option can be replaced with a version

<key>Fast</key>

<true/>

In this  case,  you can save you   extra load time by not downloading  the interface and its  elements. That is, and no chance to get any amends in case of an error. Saving  a whole second will probably enrich  you?!

The system  will start  loading immediately  from  the section set in  the  following  setting

<key>DefaultVolume</key>

<string>MacHDD</string>

the name of the section, as you called it, how you displayed in the downloader's log. However, the name can also be given to NVRAM after the reboot of the "Startup Disk" control panel. The name givento NVRAM is a priority. That is, we will be loaded from the volume from which we were loaded last time. If the setting is not set at all, it is only on the control panel.

 

You can also identify the uploader by default

<key>DefaultLoader</key>

<string>bootmgfw.efi</string>

That is, if there are several downloaders on one section, we will choose the one required to download by default. In this example, we expect to ship winddows by default to UEF. If not specified, then boot.efi. Again, "Boot Drive" will change this installation during the restart, so ensures the auto-launch Of Windows through the Mac panel.

<key>Legacy</key>

<string>PBR</string>

Legacy Boot, which is needed to run older versions of Windows and Linux, depends very much on the hardware part, on the construction of bios, so several algorithms have been developed, and the choice of algorithm is made in this vein. Options:

LegacyBiosDefault is for those UEFI BIOS that have a LegacyBios protocol.

PBRtest,   PBR, PBRsata  - variants of the PBR boot algorithm, whoever is lucky.

In general, to achieve unconditional work legasi-but failed. It's easier and better to forget about the legosysystem, and put UEFI system variants.

<key>Arguments</key>

<string>-v arch=i386</string>

These are arguments that are transmitted to boot.efi, and it, in turn, transfers part of them to the core of the system. A specific list of kernel arguments should be found in Apple's documentation. A list of arguments required by boot.efi can be foundfrom the manual at com.apple.boot.plist.

The following kernel mach_kernel.amd slide are best known

darkwake=0 nvda_drv=1

To download UEFI to 10.8 or 10.9, you need a slide-0 key. Since the audit of 1887

it is added automatically when needed. Starting with the 4369 audit, there's an AptioMemoryFix driver, and you can't write with it, implying an automatic4369.

Starting with audit 3712 (actually later due to bugs), in the Details menu caused by the space, you have the opportunity to mouse choose the desired arguments from the list:

L"arch=i386",                         //0

SMBIOS.table1->ProductName

You can only specify the name of the product, and Clover will calculate all the other parameters corresponding to this model on your own tables.

The new options will be  a priority. However,  I will not list the list of names familiar to Clover,  cutchen, only 83 models, I will not list.

If the model is not set, clover will put something from this list, see in the menu, how satisfied you are with this choice. Change at your discretion.

It is desirable to enter their serial numbers. You can take an exemplary one and change one letter in the middle. It usually goes away. The first three and the last four cannot be changed.

&& (featureFlags & 0x00000001)) {

Device (GFX0)

{

 

 

.....

Name (_ADR,  Zero)            // _ADR: Address Name (_SUN,  0x02)

 

Device (GIGE)

{

Name (_ADR,  Zero)           // _ADR: Address Name (_SUN,  0x03)

 

Avoid ID q 0x00 and 0x01 because of optimization in zero and One. Clover may not be able to handle such a patch.

At thispoint, such a trick is only possible with  ATI, NVidia, LAN, WIFI, Firewire devices

These are predetermined names, Clover will find a device that matches that name.

If you want a more accurate match, first look at your OEM SBMIOS, which you can get from the DarwinDumper report, what tables you have no.9, which SUN are tied to which devices. Then fix the DSDT to match thesenaming requirements, and add yours.

Handle 0x0905, DMI type 9, 17 bytes

0000: 09 11 05 09 01 a6 08 03 03 02 00 04 02 00 00 00

0010: fe

_SUN 2 (highlighted in green).

Cpu

This group of parameters helps with the definition of CPU when internal algorithms

they can't cope.

<key>FrequencyMHz</key>

<string>3200</string>

The basic frequency of the processor in MHz. Clover usually gets this value by costing an ACPI-based timer, but if it turns out wrong, you can frame it through that key.

This key only affects the digit in the profiler systems. Cosmetics!

Forexample, I'm a Hazwell denomination of 1800, and the initial speed of 2400.

<key>BusSpeedkHz</key>

<string>133330</string>

This option, the basic frequency of the bus, is critical to the system and is passed from theloader to the core. If the frequency is wrong, the kernel does not start at all, if the frequency does not correspond a little, there may be problems with the clock, and very strange behavior of the system.

The value in DMI is stored in MHz, and it is inaccurate, more correctly calculated efrom the frequency of the     CPU,  well, you can  pick up your value more accurately, and write  it  in  this key  in kilohertz.    

One moment. Some manufacturers have a different notion that there is BusSpeed and that there is FSBSpeed, and enter into a BIOS value four times greater.

It is clear that if ASUS writes the frequency of the 1600MHz tire, and the processor multiplier 8, the formula will not converge, the processors at 12.8GHz do not exist. 


<key>UseARTFrequency</key>

<false/>

SkyLake processors have a new base frequency setting that changes with a smaller step than the bus frequency, the so-called ARTFrequency, which typically has a value of 24MHz. Clover can calculate it and pass it on to the core, and the Captain will understand it and use it.

However, in practice, the calculated frequency leads to inaccurate work, so  it can simply be banned, in  which case the core of the system will act in its own way. In clover's new version of thedoe lano rounding this figure, as vit9696 thinks there may be only three values and they are round,  up to  1MHz.

<key>QPI</key>

<string>4800</string>

In a system profiler, this value is called Processor Bus Speed or simply Bus Speed. Chameleon has an algorithm for its calculations for the Nehalem processors (and that is the wrong one!). In Clover, a corrected algorithm for dates from Intel has been made. There are two options in the AppleSmbios cupcakes: either the value is already spelled out in SMBIOS, After much debate, this amount is put in the config - write what you like (MHz) It doesn't affect the work in any way - clean water cosmetics.

Someone argues that modern poppies should be done this way. (I've got it!)

This option was invented by Apple and is used in the "About This Mac" window, which translates such a constant into the processor designation. Otherwise it will be shown

"Unknown processor." Why couldn't I call CPUID? (Because there was still PowerPC).

«About this Mac». Again, clean water cosmetics.

This group of options for implementing binary patches on the fly. It should be noted that this is only feasible ifthe download is done through kernelcache or through  ForceKextsToLoad. If the kext is not downloaded and is not present in the kesh, then these fixes do not work.

You need to understand that there are other algorithms in the core that will work incorrectly with unsupported CPU, so don't expect this patchto have all your problems.

<key>FakeCPUID</key>

<string>0x010676</string>

This patch, introduced with Audit 2748, serves to replace KernelCpu. It doesn't just block the core's panic, it replaces the processor ID so that all calls respond as supported. In particular, it also affects the AppleIntelCPUPowerManagement.kext cupcake. Inthe first example, he substitutes the Penrin PROCESSOR ID, which is supported by all OSX versions from 10.5 to 10.14, where it came to an end.

<key>AppleIntelCPUPM</key>

<true/>

It turns out that BIOS on the motherboards of ASUS (which once us ASUS northotics mood?) writes in the MSR register 0xE2 bit 14, and the register becomes ReadOnly, but it is used in the AppleIntelCPUPowerManagementcupcake, and is used on the record. 

Bet Yes  if at the start of the system you have a panic on this  cupcake. (Yes, the E2 register has a WriteOnce property,  i.e. you    can  only write it down once before you reboot). It's relevant forSandy and above.     They say it's  good for Windowes, as well.

<key>AppleRTC</key>

<true/>

OsX's operating system somehow doesn't work as well with CMOS as it is provided by BIOS, as a result when waking up from sleep or rebooting there is a reset of CMOS.    

However, in  some  cases, this paschdoesnot  help. Then you can correct the AppleRTC  cupcake itself,  which is what is being done here. It's out of date! vit9696 investigated the problem,  and corrected Clover's operations with  RTC,  now  the recommended value of the key is zlt;false/qgt; as it affects hibernation. Although,  controversially, I still have the hibernation key  in NVRAM.

Patching with Mask

Since  the 5095  audit,  the ability tomask  binary  patches    has been introduced.   This applies to KextPatches, KernelPatches and  BootPatches

I'll tell you in a separate place, keeping in mind all three points.

It looks like this (the specific data is unrealistic, just as a method.

So, in addition to the sixteen-line Find, we can  also set the MaskFind mask, bit. If  a  bit  is  1,  we are looking for an exact  match,  if it is 0,  we ignore the  difference.

And for the Replace line, the MaskReplace mask means that the bits are a replacement, and we leave it as it was.

Example:

1.       Find all the lines in the specified cupcake,  it also works in the core, or in boot.efi clever or  Clever. The difference in the first letter,  it differs by a bit of 0x20. That  is, we set the search mask DF FF FF FF FF  FF. This  means that we are making upall bytes (letters) except the first one, in  which we ignore a large  letter or a small one.   This  means that  the unspecified bytes must be the same

2.       Replace the third letter with "o" in thefound words,  meaning we'll get a clover or Clover, respectively.

MaskReplace = 00 00 FF 00 00 00

The line can be cut to the right, because it is supposed to fill with zero. At the same time, those bytes that we do not replace, it would be possible to not tell inReplace, but there is a requirement of exact conformity of length.

To maintain the new Clover's backward compatibility with the old confit, it is assumed that the unspecified mask (missing) consists of a FFFFFF, i.e. an accurate match to the search bar, and a complete replacement of all bytes to specified.

Symbolic patching.

Since the 5119 audit, we have more search and patch capabilities. General syntax

<dict>

<key>Comment</key>

<string>Symbolic patch example got lapic panic</string>

<string>All</string>

<key>Disabled</key>

<true/>

<key>Procedure</key>

<string>_lapic_interrupt</string>

<integer>200</integer>

<key>StartPattern</key>

<data>ACnHeAAx241H+oM=</data>

<key>MaskStart</key>

<data>/////wA=</data>

<key>Find</key>

<data>6AAA//+DAAAAAAAA</data>

<key>MaskFind</key>

<data>/wAA////AAAAAP//</data>

<key>Replace</key>

<data>6AAA//8xwJCQkJCQ</data>

<key>MaskReplace</key>

<data>/wAA////////////</data>

</dict>

MatchOS put All because we believe this method of patching is independent of the version of the system.

Disabled is still true because this is an unrealistic example.

Procedure here write the name ofthe procedure, which we are looking for.

In general, the size of this procedure is simply the sizeof thesearch.

 StartPattern was invented before the symbolic patch.

MaskStart is a mask for the starting point, that is for       StartPattern.

At 10.12, the connectors  will be  different, so this  method should be considered obsolete,  although the methodof ic calculation is still the same.

I'll tell you more about how to get these numbers.

Original article from bcc9 http://www.insanelymac.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=249642  Full recipe from Xmedik in Russian language with discussions  http://www.applelife.com.au/threads/factory-ati-hd-6xxx-5xxx-4xxx.28890/  Here I will set out shorter, tailored to the specifics of KLover.

1.  First of all, you need to get your video bios. Download CloverGUI and click F6. Your Bios  will be stored in the file /EFI/CLOVER/misc/c0000.bin, unless, of course, Clover is installed in the section with the FAT32 file system.

2.  Download the radeon_bios_decode program on one of these links. In the  same folder with this utility put  a  bios  file  c0000.bin. Let's say  it's  a folder of  q/RadeonPatch  Perform in the terminal the following commands  

cd ~/RadeonPatch

./radeon_bios_decode < c0000.bin

3.  Youwon't get information on your  connectors on   the ekra that should be copied/photographed for further  use.

That's what I have.

iMac:test slice$ ./radeon_bios_decode <c0000.bin ATOM BIOS Rom:

SubsystemVendorID: 0x1458 SubsystemID: 0x2557 IOBaseAddress: 0xe000

Filename: R667D32I. F1 BIOS Bootup Message:

GV-R667D3-2GI/F1

 

PCI ID: 1002:6758

Connector at index 0

Type [@offset 44282]: HDMI-A (11)

Encoder [@offset 44286]: INTERNAL_UNIPHY2 (0x21) i2cid [@offset 44356]: 0x92, OSX senseid: 0x3

Connector at index 1

Type [@offset 44292]: DVI-D (3)

Encoder [@offset 44296]: INTERNAL_UNIPHY (0x1e) i2cid [@offset 44383]: 0x95, OSX senseid: 0x6

Connector at index 2

Type [@offset 44302]: VGA (1)

Encoder [@offset 44306]: INTERNAL_KLDSCP_DAC1 (0x15) i2cid [@offset 44410]: 0x90, OSX senseid: 0x1

 

4.  Download the script ati-personality.pl on one of the links

5.  Put in the same folder,  and run in the terminal  perl ati-personality.pl -386 zgt;frames.txt  if you do it for a 32-bit system,  or

 

perl ati-personality.pl >frames.txt

for 64-bit.

Attention! In Sierra, the texts have changed, so the patch is system-dependent.

 

6.  Now we need to decide on the choice      ofthe  suitable     framework.  

5000 series: mobil - Alouatta, desktop - Baboon 6000 series: mobile - Cattail, desktop - Ipomoea 7000 series: mobile - Pondweed, desktop -  Futomaki.

 

7.  For the selected  framework,  take  a printout of connectors  from  our frames file.txt received at step  5.

0000000 00  04  00 00  04 03  00  00 00  01 00 00  12  04  01  05

0000010 00 08 00 00 04 02 00 00 00 01 00 00  11 02  04 03

<key>PCIRootUID</key>

It turns out that the injection of graphics card properties depends on how much is in DevicePath'PciRoot (0x0) or PciRoot (0x1). However, at the dawn of the hackintheanization it turned out that this number is just an ID spelled out in DSDT.

Device (PCI0)

{

Name (_HID, EisaId ("PNP0A08")) Name (_CID, EisaId ("PNP0A03"))

Name (_ADR,  Zero)

 


Name (_UID, Zero)

_UID- 0, if  oneis equal, means 1.

Moreover, if this number is forcibly changed, it will change, and will work successfully. Now, the real Macs always have 0. And accordingly boot.efi always assumes 0, so it is better if you correct your DDD, Clover does it by default, and such ahatch in the confit is no longer.

Installation of sound card properties. However, it only works if the device in DSDT is called HDEF, if you do its renaming, then the rest can be otherwise injected. Also, these efforts are not needed when using the VoodooHDA driver.

Options for the values are:

NO - nothing is injected, for example, if you inject properties through Properties

Detect is an automatic definition of an installed sound chip to use its ID as a leiout.

883 - in the decimal form of the leiout number. This is referring to The Realtek ALC883.

0x0373 - the same in 16-year form becomes unrecognizable.

In fact, these numbers are incorrect, the correct layout, for example, is 12 to 0x0C, but, oddly enough, are valid.

With the advent of AppleALC, this option has taken on a new lease of life. Now  it really is the leiout number, and you need to select it from the list recommended for  your  sound codec. See the documentation for this  cupcake.

ResetHDA - If the sound chip is not turned on for some reason, this key can help with the initial  launch. It  also    affects  Windowes. Necessity  seen after the reboot from Windows to  Mack.

AFGLowPowerState - affects the AppleHDA driver, and kind of has to solve the problem with clicks in the speakers when you fall asleep/wakeup the soundsof the th pope.

In this group of settings, you can relabele your unsupported device into a supported device. Examples:

–        AMDRadeonHD7850 has a DeviceID'0x6819, which  is not backed by atI7000Controller and  ATIRadeonX3000  in the 10.8 system. There's  support for DeviceID'0x6818.   For it to come into force it is required     to somehow intrigue. There  are two options for video cards:    either  Inject--gt;ATI'true,  or DsdtFixMask includes 0x0100  (FixDisplay).

–                   The NVidia GTX660 has a DeviceID'0x1183, the card  works  in any    way,  but AGPM is not provided for  it.

–        The    WiFi  card  in the Dell laptop is called Dell Wireless 1595, DeviceID'0x4315, in reality it is Broadcom,  which supports chips 4312, 4331, and  a number of   others.

–        The popular Marvell 80E8056 DeviceID'0x4353 network card doesn't work that   way,  but  works with the  AppleYukon2 driver if you switch ID to 0x4363.    

–        IMEI - This device works together with the Intel HD3000/4000, however,  not the fact that your chipset has the right ID.  

SandyBridge = 0x1C3A8086 IvyBridge = 0x1E3A8086 Haswell = 0x8C3A8086

Works with the DSDT fix AddIMEI_80000 (AddIMEI)

Starting with the audit of 1129 parameters are taken from THESIOS, and there is no need. MLB = BoardSerialNumber

<key>MLB</key>

<string>XXXXXXXXXX</string>

Numbers and letters, 17 characters long, meaning the serial number of the motherboard. There is no regularity. Most reliable, take a real number, and swap withradish numbers, for example, write ... SLICE... Who's got a fantasy.

<key>ROM</key>

<data>AAAAAAAA</data>

Six pairs of 16-digits, often matching McKea's network card address. There are, however, reports that the service works with arbitrary c ifrs.

And most importantly, registration in iMessage implies a paid service, you have to specify a real bank  card,  from  which you will be    charged $1. Those  who try to enter the sneer  receive messages like "Call Apple."

<key>MountEFI</key>

This option tells the start-up script that if you log in, you should mount the ESP (EFI System Partition) section. This option for most people is unnecessary or temporary, it is worth in confitge to prescribe No, and in the menu if necessary to put Yes.

Another possible value is disk1 if you have multiple discs, and each has its own EFI section.

The download log is needed by the developers, and ordinary users can put No.

<key>LogLineCount</key>

<string>3000</string>

The number of lines in this log, then comes the displacing of old lines with new ones, so that there is no unlimited p remainder ofthis file.

It's really not interesting to save up these logs. You can always get the last log by the team

$ bdmesg > ~/Desktop/boot-log.txt

Quirks

The history of this section is this. Start developing Clover for UEFI download

Dazar it was the development of a driver to adjust the memory, which is left behind by UEFI BIOS Aptio (American Megatrend). Conflict doesn't just affect memory, it's still boot.efi debarks virtualization of addresses, and it affects pointers, function and so on.

I note that this   problem was not  with  Legasy   Clover,    because  in  this  case Allocate from EDK2 is used, and it allocates memory from top to bottom.  

For a long time after dmazar's departure, no one was referring to this driver, except maybesome single-line additives like Free2000.But there's also a ReddestDream programmer who decided to separate all of these developments from OpenCore into a separate driver, Oc'uyrks.efi, which works in conjunction with the OpenRuntime.efi driver, and all the settings are recorded in the Oc's file to use all of this with the Clover loader.

And then my move. I need to have all the sourceand in one repo, so that it is possible to do bisection.

That is, if you can not immediately load, you can try to go into this menu and change some installation yes-no.

Now the details about each item. The defaults are set.

<key>AvoidRuntimeDefrag</key>

<true/>

Prevents memory defragmentation for runtime-services, such as NVRAM support.

<key>DevirtualiseMmio</key>

<false/>

Removes runtime from some of the known mmIO areas. Not recommended for systems older than Sandy Bridge. However, according to my observations, the list of known regions can still be supplemented in the mmioWhitelist picks section.

 

<key>MmioWhitelist</key>

<array/>

The list of regions is set as an array of dictionaries

<dict>

<key>Comment</key>

It's such a region.

<key>Address</key>

<string>0xffe00000</string>

<key>Enabled</key>

<true/>

</dict>

 

<key>DisableSingleUser</key>

<false/>

Prohibit the use of command line mode because it is not safe. ;)

<key>DisableVariableWrite</key>

<false/>

Prohibits access from MAKOS to NVRAM by record, for security.

<key>DiscardHibernateMap</key>

<false/>

When waking upand out of hibernation use an old memory card.

<key>EnableSafeModeSlide</key>

<true/>

By default, downloading in safe mode gives slide-0. This patch allows youto use another value set in the ProvideCustomSlide pickaxe.

<key>ProvideCustomSlide</key>

<false/>

Or not, to use an automatic calculation of the slide value. The need is visible from the log if there is a message OCABC: Only N/256 slide values are usable!

<key>ProvideMaxSlide</key>

<integer>0</integer>

The value is 1 to 254, for the case above.  255 is the default, and this can lead to memory allocation errors.

<key>EnableWriteUnprotector</key>

<true/>

Removes a bit of recording protection in the Runtime services page. Due to the insecurity of this pickaxe there is another RebuildAppleMemoryMap. That is, for systems older than 2018 put  EnableWriteUnprotector - True

RebuildAppleMemoryMap - False SyncRuntimePermissions — False

And for newer, supportive MATS, if there is such a table ACPI in BIOS

EnableWriteUnprotector - False RebuildAppleMemoryMap - True SyncRuntimePermissions - True

<key>ForceExitBootServices</key>

<false/>

Repeat with the new MemoryCards.

<key>ProtectMemoryRegions</key>

<false/>

Changes the attributes of some regions when there is a conflict between the concepts of macos and BIOS. This pick includes several fixes, including one developed personally by me, one that protects the CSM region. In particular, if your graphics card does not have UEFI VBIOS, this pick should be included.

 

<key>ProtectSecureBoot</key>

<false/>

Practice has shown that it doesn't work for everyone, Another possible pair of values 0x0CF9/0x06,  which means restart through the PCI bus.

<true/>

And this fixes the problem of turning off/going to sleep at UEFI-loading. The fix is made once, before calling boot.efi, so 100% efficiency is not guaranteed. Nevertheless, it issafe enough, at least on Intel chipsets.

<key>smartUPS</key>

<false/>

In fact, this option is designed to be used to write a feed profile in the FADT table. The logic is:

PM'1 - desktop, powered by the network

PM'2 - notebook, powered by network or battery

The PM'3 is a server powered by SmartUPS, which MacOSX also knows something about.

The choice between 1 and 2 Clover will make based on the analysis of the bit of mobility, but there is also a Mobile option in the  SMBIOS section.

For P-states, the table complements the processor section with _PPC, _PCT and _PSS methods.

_PCT - Performance Control - control of speedstep control.

_PPC - Performance Present Capabilities - speedstep capabilities, Thisfeature returns one number, which means frequency  limitation.

_PSS - Performance Supported States - a set of possible CPU states - P-states. This array is formed based on the data about the processor that  Clover has already calculated, as well as taking into account the user's parameters:

<key>PLimitDict</key>

<string>1</string>

The essence of the option is very simple - to limit the maximum frequency of the processor. Value 0 - work to the maximum, 1 - one step less than the maximum, 2 - on two steps. Example: The Core2Duo T8300 2400MHz works at a maximum frequency of 2000 if limited toa level 2000. Why would you do that? Yes, so that  the laptop does not overheat, there the capabilities of the CPU far exceed the ability to cool. Exactly  the same option is present in plista platforms, such as:  System/Library/Extensions/IOPlatformPluginFamily.kext/Contents/PlugIns/ACPI_SMC_PlatformPlugin.kext/Contents/Resources/MacBook5_1.plist  

Next, we will discuss these plists.

For some processors, such as Core2'u', it's noted that PlimitDict works the other way around, and the best option is the one. It is possible that this is just a mistake in the DDDT. For example, because they did not want to make a Darwin patch

Other ACPI tables

Clover has a service for loading other tables. In particular, it is very common to manufacture a whole library of different SSDT-xxx.aml for different devices and for speedstep. Since the revision of 3088, the rule of loading such tables has changed.

Tables put inapka

/EFI/CLOVER/OEM/xxx/ACPI/patched/

if there is no such folder, the shared folder is considered

/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/patched/

All files with the ".aml" extension that do not start with the "." point and do not contain the "DSDT" line in their name will be loaded,sweating that the DSDT of one of the different variants is loaded on another algorithm.

The download order is not guaranteed. If we want a strictly defined download order, we have to write this explicitly in a confit

<key>ACPI</key>

<dict>

<key>SortedOrder</key>

<array>

<string>SSDT-3.aml</string>

<string>SSDT-1.aml</string>

<string>SSDT-2.aml</string>

</array>

And if such an  array  is present,  only these tables will be  loaded,  and strictly in  this  order.

Another  problem  with the tables is  the  name. OEM  does not shy away  from  using the national alphabet, nor just the lack of a name, but   for Apple it is   unacceptable.   

<key>FixHeaders</key>

Find->PXSX, Replace->ARPT. But if in the section DSDT-'gt'gt;Patches  such replacement operates on the entire space, in the  method  renameDevices the algorithm  will  look only for    those devices  that lie on the specified bridge.

DSDT adjustment

 

DSDT - Differentiated System Description Table is the largest and most complex APPI table. The minimum length is 36 bytes, the real one is 20kb or more. This table describes devices and how to access them. Access methods can contain arithmetic and logicalexpressions, and thus represent a program in a kind of programming language similar to C of their curly braces.

   And why do you need to fix     it?    The fact  is  that the OSX system has a       cupcake        AppleIntelCPUPowerManagement,  which serves to control the power of the processor (speedstep), and  which  strictly  needs the system to have an HPET that has an interruption of ir.

You can only work by banning, or removing this cupcake. But there is another option - to adjust the DSDT, and the HPET device will turn on as it should be! However, in the system  10.9 the requirements were changed. Nonsense! Patch is still needed, and has the same power.

This is patch number 1,a vital necessity.   Is McOs the only one who needs this  NRT? No,  of course,  but the manufacturers of BIOS are just beginning to realize this and prescribe the right parameters, until now  rarely  meet that  DSDT  worked without a patch.

Moment 2. In DDDT you can see some dependence on the operating system,Windows98, Windows 2001, Windows 2006, Linux, MAKOS has a "Darwin" ID, and usually it is not designed for DDT. MacOSX is a serious ACPI system, i.e. uses DDDT for the maximumof the u as well as it is used byWindows 2001, but not Linux, not Windows 98, and not Windows 2006. On many BIOS this is appropriateto the value ofOSYS q 0x07D2. But not 0x2410, as it is prescribed in the nativist. We need to look at the algorithm.

On my Skylake 2017 the best value was 0x7DA. That'FixDarwin7_10000 s why Ihave 0x7D9, and it affects usb3.0, why did BIOS decide to turn it off for WindowsXP. 

Moment 3. The manufacturer of the system board, and with it and his BIOS, and its DDDT, can not foresee what processor will be installed, what graphics card and other PCI setup. Conversely, to exclude from DDDT such devices as speaker, floppy drive, parallel port.

DSDT is in BIOS and is used in the system in the binary code AML, there is a compiler/decomplin IASL, which translates codes into a language understandable to humans

Dsl.      And then there is the moment  No.4.   In the process of editing, it is necessary to correct them.                     (It's strange, but compilation/decompilation  are not strictly reverse operations, back and forth  changes  the table, or even ingeneral,  goes there,   back and forth no - intervention is required. Looking  from my  bell tower, this       means  that  the  decompinator is written with   errors,    such  programmers have worked on  it.

When we've come all this way, we can put our corrected DSDT to the downloader by putting it in the folder /EFI/CLOVER/XXX/ACPI/patched, or, if OEM the name of the computer is not yet known, into the folder /EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/patched, or the downloadable system itself has its own version of DCD.

         Where    to get    the original  DDDT  that needs to be  patched? 

Be patient if the save  is  on     a flash drive, and the tables are   many, the process  may take a noticeable time.   To do this, in Clover's interface,  enterm in Options Menu, change the DSDT mask,  then  leave  the menu and press  F5. Clover will save your  DDDT,  corrected to the current  mask, with a name such as  DSDT-F597.aml,  ie.   patched with  a mask  0xF597. You can  make  several  options to  then  compare.

Now  you can  take the DSDT  file  and  edit... And  for             those  who are not  strong in the  asl language, Clover suggests making  some   fixes  automatically.

Yes, DDDT is a set of descriptions and methods, many of which we do not need. Clover doesn't touch them, even if we put the maximum mask on. Errors can be heldin places untouched, and they remain there.

 

Let's take a closer look at the fixes. In the 4300 audit, the description of the fixes was simplified.

AddDTGP      bit(0):

To describe the properties of the device, in addition to the DeviceProperties variant discussed above, there is an option with the _DSM method  prescribed in  DSDT.

_DSM - Device Specific Method - is well known  for this  method,  which works in MacOSX starting in version 10.5, this method contains an array describing the device and a challenge to the universal  DTGP method, which  is  the same for all devices.

This fix simply adds this method ton oth it to apply to other fixes. I saw the advice to put a mask 0x31, they say, the rest of the fixes are not needed.

FixDarwin bit(1):

Mimicry OS Darwin under the Windows XP system. Many sleep problems and withI'm growing feet out of a misidentification system.

FixDarwin7 bit(16)

Similarly, only mimicry under the Windows 7 system. In the old DDDT there may not be a check under such a system. You have options.

FixShutdown bit(2):

The TS _P featureis added to the condition: if the argument is 5 (off), then no other action should be done. However, there is repeated confirmation of the effectiveness of this patch for the ASUS boards, maybe for others. 

AddMCHC      bit(3):

Such a 0x060000 device is usually not available in DSDT, but for some chipsets this device is serviced and therefore needs to be prescribed to properly dilute the power management of the PCI tire. The question of the needfor a patch is solved experimentally.

FixHPET      bit(4):

As already said, this is the main fix necessary.

Thus, the minimally needed DDDT patch mask looks like 0x0010

FakeLPC     bit(5):

Replaces DeviceID LPC controller to make the AppleLPC cupcake cling to it.

It is needed for  those  cases where the    chipset is not  provided  for  OSX  (e.g.  ICH9). However, the home list of Chipsets Intel and NForce is so  large that the need for  such a patch   is very rare. 

Although, this is not a fact either.     It happens  that  the cupcake itself is unloaded from memory for lack of need,  although  the chipset is supported.

FixIPIC     bit(6):

Removes interruption from IPIC device. This fix affects the Power key (a popping window with Reset, Sleep, Shutdown variants).

FixSBUS     bit(7):

Adds SMBusController to the device tree, thereby removing the warning that it is missing from the system log. And it also creates the right tire power control wiring, it also affects sleep.

FixDisplay bit(8):

Makea number of patches_DSM for the graphics card. (1974)

Patches for all graphics cards, only for non-Intel. For the built-in Intellectuals is another bit. FIX_INTELGFX_100000

Also added is the HDMI device (HDAU) if necessary.

FixIDE      bit(9):

In the system 10.6.1 there was panic on the AppleIntelPIIXATA cupcake. Two ways to solve the problem - the use of a corrected muffin, or fix the device in the DDDT. And for more modern systems? Let it be if there is such a controller.

FixSATA    bit(10):

Fifixes some problems with SATA, and removes the yellowness of disk icons in the system by mimicry under ICH6. Actually controversial method, but without this fix I have DVDs are not lost, and la DVD drive should not be removable.

There is an alternative, solved by the addition of a fix with a cupcake AppleAHCIport.kext. See the chapter about the cupcake patch.

And, accordingly, this bit can not be put! One of those few bits that I recommend not to bet.

FixFirewire bit(11):

Adds a "fwhub" property to the Firewire controller if it is. If not, nothing will happen. You can bet if you don't knowif you need to or not.

FixUSB    bit(12):

Trying to solve numerous USB problems. For the XHCI controller, when using native or patched IOUSBFamily, such a DSDT patch is irreplaceable.

Apple driver specifically uses ACPI, and the DSDT should becorrect.

FixLAN     bit(13):

The "built-in" property for the network card is necessary for the correct operation. Also injected is a model of the card - for cosmetics.

FixAirport     bit(14):

Similarly, LAN also creates the device itself, if not yet registered in DSDT. For some well-known models, DeviceID is replaced with supported. And the airport is turned on without other patches.

Adjusting the description of the sonic tothe art point  in  the DDD  to work the native driver of AppleHDA.

The required patch for SandyBridge and above is to add an IMEI device to the device tree if it wasn't there yet.

The patch for the built-in Intel graphics is separated from the rest of the graphics cards, that is, you can put an injection for Intel and not put for Nwedia.

Adds Return to the _WAK method. It must be, but for some reason it is often not contained by the DDDT. Apparently the authors adhered to some other standards. In any case, this fix is completely safe.

Removes unused floppy-type devices. What would you be worried about?

In fact, CRT and DVI devices are still being removed here - a perfectly necessary condition for the launch of IntelX3100 on Dell laptops. Otherwise, the black screen, checked by hundreds of uselei.

 

FixADP1

Corrects the ADP1 device (power supply) that is necessary for the laptop to sleep properly when it is plugged into the socket, or when it is taken out of it.

Inserts the device PNLF (Backlight), which is necessary to properly control the brightness of the ekwound, and, oddly enough, helps to solve the problem with sleep,  including  for the desktop.

Similarly, this patch solves a sleep problem.

 

FixACST

Some DSDT has a device, or method, or variable named ACST, but this name is used by MacOSX 10.8 to control c-state.

conflict with very obscure behavior. This fix renames all the occurrences of such a name into something safe.

Can't figure out how you can ignore this series of patches?! Don't you needa well-functioning computer?

 

AddHDMI

Adds an HDAU device to the DSDT that matches HDMI to the ATI or Nvidia graphics card. It is clear that once the card was bought separately from the motherboard, then in the native DSDT such a device simply does not exist. In addition, the device is injected with the property hda-gfx'onboard-1 or onboard-2 due to the circumstances:

-1 if UseIntelHDMI'false

-2 if there is an Intell port, which occupied port 1.

 

FixRegions

And this is a very special patch. If the rest of the patches were intended for editing BIOS.aml, to create a good DSDT out of nothing, then this fix is designed for the final yusting of a well-made custom DSDT.aml, and for BIOS.aml it is useless.

There are regions in DDDT that have their addresses, such as:

OperationRegion (GNVS,  SystemMemory,  0xDE6A5E18,  0x01CD)

The problem is that the address of this region is created by BIOS dynamically, and it can  be different  from download to   download.     aml  this number is fixed,  which  may not correspond to the   truth. 

This fix corrects all regions in the custom DDT to the values in bios DSDT, and thus the mask

<key>Fixes</key>

<dict>

<key>FixRegions</key>

<true/>

</dict>

is a sufficient mask if you have a well-made DSDT with all your necessary fixes.

 

There is another patch, but it concerns not DSDT, but in general all ACPI tables, and takes place here illegally.

FixHeaders

It will check the headlines notonly DSDT, but all ACPI tables in general, solving the problem of Chinese characters in the names of tables that MAKOS does not tolerate, immediately panicking.

Choosing patches

How to choose which patches are needed, which are harmless and which are dangerous? 

You can try and download with the current mask. In order not to interfere with the real, patched DDDT, already present in the system, you can specify in the menu

DSDT name: BIOS.aml

Without finding such a file, the system will take the OEM DSDT from BIOS and make fixes over it, according to the installed mask. If you fail after you reboot your computer, the current installations will be lost, and the default installations that you have will be able to install will takeeffect.

The 0xFFFFFFFF mask corresponds to the inclusion of all fixes, and if the OS then loads, the work of programmers is well spent. According to the description above, you have already realized that some fixes you just do not need (for example WIFI). Since the 1992 audit, work has been done to prevent panic on the double patch, So don't be afraid to ask extra bits. Two fixes at the moment I wouldn't recommend using: FIX_SATA, bit 0x0400, it's better to use a binary cupcake patch, and FIX_SHUTDOWN, bits AddMCHC_0008 0x04, andthe bo instead of it almost always works installationHaltEnabler'true, working more correctly.

To see how the DSDT patches affected the result,  the pre-life,you couldn't    load, you  can  prescribe in the confit,  in the ACPI section, the following key:

<key>DSDT</key>

<dict>

<key>Debug</key>

<true/>

At the same time, two files in the folder will be saved before the system starts

/EFI/CLOVER/ACPI/origin/ DSDT-or.aml

DSDT-pa15.aml

origin is your DSDT loaded from the disk, or taken from BIOS, before the patches are applied.

patched - after applying patches.

Since you haven't been able to download, you'll also make more attempts, and patched files will be numbered sequentially without mashing up old information. 15 in this case is the 15th download attempt, apparently successful, you need to see what the problem of the 14th attempt was.

Still, I recommend  avoiding the double patch. There  may also be a situation  where a double patch  occurs  because  OEM DSDT already has  a  method  _DSM  when  we  want to insize our own. So  you need to put up the DropOEM_DSM masked bit    → →s.

→ DropOEM_DSM. No, you need to rename all OEM DSM.

 

Hand editing DSDT

Prerequisites

 

You need to have a computer with some kind of operating system so you can edit text files. Or you've already put macOS on this computer somehow, and now you want to improve DSDT.

For any operating system there is a compiler of the command line iasl.  Including  for Windows, iasl.exe runs in a command line as in  a  poppy,  has the same functions,  and  gives  the  same  results. Editing  texts  in  Windes  is inconvenient,  notepad has no  backlit syntax and numbering lines, it's best to take Notepad.        

For Windows, visit acpica.org Windows Binary Tools

You should also stock up on the description of the language of the APPI ACPI_6_2.pdf. It is better to take a new version, because you need to deal with the fact of DDDT that you slipped a fresh BIOS.

 

 

Creating a blank

 

First, make yourself a flash drive with Clover, boot, even without the system. It is important that it is in the FAT32 format.  We load        on  this computer from this flash drive to the Clover interface.   We go to  the SECTION ACPI-qgt; there we find  DSDT Name: and enter BIOS.aml. This is exactly the  DSDT that    you  could  get in the winds through  Aida. We go down the menu and choose DSDT fixes - there you can put ticks, clavoy or  mouse. We put almost all the ticks  that do not cause you rejection.For example, do not need Firewire, Airport, IDE if you know that you do not have such devices. All the unfamiliar is better to put.

You come back from  this  substitution,  and  press  consecutively  the keys  F2,  F4,  F5.

 

You can turn off the subject and carry the flash drive to        the  computer  where    you edit  the files.

 

EFI\CLOVER\ACPI\origin EFI\CLOVER\misc

 

We copy these folders into our work folder on a  computer  where there is iasl. At least  with    Mac,  at least  with Winda.

$ iasl -da SSDT*.aml DSDT-*.aml

 

Option -da makes a magic thing, it searches for symbols at once on all files, so that in the end there should be no unknown characters. However, this is ideal. In practice it doesn't work, we get a lot of errors like AE_ALREADY_EXISTS

~~~

 

The other option is more successful

iasl -e SSDT*.aml -d DSDT-*.aml

It turns out that it was not exported           from there.   A simple copy of the text, from that SSDT from the first curly  brace to the last in the tail  of DSDT.dsl before the last  bracket.

Name (_HID, EisaId ("PNP0C14") /* Windows Management Instrumentation Device */)

What did you do?

 

- CreateDWordField (BUF0, \_SB. PCI0._Y0F._LEN, MSLN) // _LEN: Length

+ CreateQWordField (BUF0, \_SB. PCI0._Y0F._LEN, MSLN) // _LEN: Length

 

The tip was in the compilation log

ResourceTag larger then field (size mismatch tag 64bit, Field 32 bit)

The rule is simple, tag is what you need, field - what needs to be corrected

tag=1 => CreateBitField tag=8 => CreateByteField tag=16 => CreateWordField tag=32 => CreateDWordField tag=64 => CreateQWordField

 

It is necessary to correct, so that in real work the sent valuee did not come to the next field.

Native speedstep

It is better to say the Power and Frequency Of Processor (UPI) -- in English it will be EIST - Enhanced Intel Speedstep Technology, from where the Russian word "Speedstep" will be.

Actually, this theme is not so much fordownloading the chik, as in general to set up the Hackos, but since Clover makes some steps, we will describe a separate chapter.

Clover does not do everything you need, it is necessary and a little work with his hands.

What is it for? The point is this: the processor in inactivity works at a minimum frequency with minimal voltage, under load speed and voltage grow. (And why the tension?

UPIP canbe implemented in two ways: a specialized utility, such as KulBukController, or General Cpap, or to understand the native speedstep, the benefit of MACOS is able to do it.

The following steps are needed:

1.                                                     The DDDT  must be corrected by  HPET, which is successfully done by Clover with a 0x0010  mask.

2.                                                     There should be the right processor section, which is done by Clover on the  generatePStates-Yes key (and in addition DropSsdt)

3.                                                     MacModel should be selected as a sample of your  SMBIOS, for  which EIST technology is provided.   It turns out, not for all      models.

Paragraph 3 can be rethought as follows: let the model be more similar in configuration to the present, but we will correct its platform-plist so that the speedstep appeared.

For each model there is a plist, see here

System/Library/Extensions/IOPlatformPluginFamily.kext/Contents/PlugIns/ ACPI_SMC_PlatformPlugin.kext/Contents/Resources/MacBook5_1.plist

We look at the similarities and differences of different plists, and correct ours in the right direction.

 

ConfigArray

 

<key>ConfigArray</key>

<array>

<dict>

<key>WWEN</key>

<true/>

<key>model</key>

<string>MacBook4,1</string>

<key>restart-action</key>

<dict>

<key>cpu-p-state</key>

<integer>0</integer>

</dict>

</dict>

</array>

This restart-action key means which P-State should fall off the CPU when restarting. Only if you have this key have earned sleep and turn off the computer!

 

CtrlLoopArray

<key>CtrlLoopArray</key>

<array>

<dict>

<key>Description</key>

<string>SMC_CPU_Control_Loop</string>

...

<key>PLimitDict</key>

<dict>

<key>MacBook4,1</key>

<integer>0</integer>

</dict>

This PLimitDict key has already been mentioned in the P-states generation. Again, this is the CPU's maximum speed limit. 0 - the speed is maximum, 1- one step below the maximum. If this key is not present, the processor will get stuck at a minimum frequency.

CStateDict

<key>CStateDict</key>

<dict>

<key>MacBook4,1</key>

<string>CSD3</string>

<key>CSD3</key>

<dict>

<key>C6</key>

<dict>

<key>enable</key>

<true/>

Practice shows that this section is better to remove everything, so that  power management works on PState, and not on CState. Although, who  like,  maybe this option is worth working on.

Symptom - the processor stands at the maximum frequency, does not fall. Once the section is removed, the frequency begins to vary. 

With Skylake processors there is a new technique by the Management  of Processor Frequency, in their name called SpeedShift. 

In the CPU section we prescribe two keys (inventor - goodwin_c)

<key>CPU</key>

<dict>

<key>HWPEnable</key>

<true/>

<key>HWPValue</key>

<string>0x30002a01</string>

The first key puts 1 in the REGISTER MSR 0x770.

The second key writes a set value in the MSR 0x774 register.

 

Sleep problem

What's the problem with sleep? When all of the above is done, the computer will go to bed and wake up like an obedient child. The most important thing needed for this, Clover has already done: adjusted FADT and FACS. It remains only to correct the DDDT, to get withthe peddze, to use only good cupcakes, and you will be happy.

Good sleep can be prevented by any device, including an unsized PCI device, or a partially wound-up device. For example, AppleHDA. Sleep is categorically hindered by NullCPUPM.kext. You maynot need a peddite, but you have to do a UNT patch to run your native AppleCPUPM, and zero wasn't needed.

In DDDT,a group of methods _GPE with notifications on each device that needs to be awakened after sleep.

There was also a sleep problem when UEFI downloaded to the 10.8 system.

The problem was solved in the audit of 1942. OsxAptioFixDxe driver change: Sleep/awakening works even at 10.8, even with CsmVideoDxe. Now it's a pick Of ProtectMemoryRegions.

 

The next trick for UEFI download

<key>ACPI</key>

<dict>

<key>HaltEnabler</key>

<true/>

This corrects the state of the chipset, incorrectly initiated by UEFI-bios. For the boot Legasi CloverEFI does everything correctly, there was no such problem. Symptoms - does not go to sleep, the screen goes out, and the fans do not.

And one more trick.


 

That's without the tick "Start up automatically..." I couldn't get a wake-up call after sleep.

Hibernet

   It is also called  deep            sleep, and in general more  like a clinical death.  But it keeps its state in the sleepimage file,  and just turns off the computer  so that then, when turned on,    it just regained its condition and  woke up. 

Once upon a time with Chameleon Hibernet worked, but       only until version 10.7.2 (sort),  then dueto some changes in the system, this  technique  stopped working.

•      Download either CloverEFI (legacy) or InsydeEFI or Phoenix 2.3.1. In the current audit of 2915, there is a driver OsxAptioFix2Drv, which  allows you to have a hibernet with AMI UEFI on the system 10.9.1. But the system 10.7.5 ingeneral does notload  with this option.  

•      The system is either 10.7.5 or 10.9.1. Other systems don't wake up yet.

•      Fashion 21 or better, 29 or even 57,  although Apple insists on  25.

sudo pmset -a hibernatemode 29

Starting with Captain tato put 29 is impossible.

- copy/Library/Preferences/com.apple.PowerManagement.511CE201-1000-4000-9999-120361221216.plist on desktop. There are several such files, choose the one that corresponds to UUID in Information About The System. Redact this file to bring in 29

 

<key>Hibernate Mode</key>

<integer>29</integer>

And copy the edited file with the terminal back

sudo cp ~/Desktop/ com.apple.PowerManagement.511CE201-1000-4000-9999- 120361221216.plist /Library/Preferences/

After that, you need to reboot, only then the change will take effect.

•      If     you have   a real,  iron  NVRAM,  you  can  make  fashion  25. And  then  in  the confit we prescribe

<key>Boot</key>

<dict>

<key>StrictHibernate</key>

<true/>

•      For the 10.13 system and above, you need to turn on

<key>RtcHibernateAware</key>

<true/>

because the encryption key can be spelled out in CMOS, and because Clover has to form additional NVRAM variables. (You still have to think about the latter.

Here's how it works:

1.     We put fashion  29 (or 25) if not yet exhibited.  

2.     Send your computer  to sleep either through the menu, or close the    lid,  or press the power button if it's set  up.

3.     To          wake up,  just turn it on as usual.

(hibernated)

Whereas other systems don't.   When you click on this  icon, the system is loaded out of     them,  a few  seconds, the progress is visible at the bottom, and the system is turned  on. 

It should be noted that if the file system of the volume subjectedto modifications after hibernet, for example from the system loaded from the second section, there will be a serious risk of damage to the file system, because in the sleeping system there is a cache with a different structure.

You can undo the awakening from the image by clicking on the space on this icon and selecting "Cancel hibernation."

If the system continues tobelieve that it is necessary to wake up, it will have to be prescribed in the config:

 

<key>Boot</key>

<dict>

<key>NeverHibernate</key>

<true/>

Why is Clover running so slowly?

Some can't even wait for the launch to report that Clover isn't working.

Let's take a closer look at this issue.

1.   On display debug.log.

<key>Boot</key>

<dict>

<key>Debug</key>

<true/>

Yes, this is very valuable information to find out what doesn't work and why. But keep in mind  that    this is  very  slowing down the  launch. If  Clover  is installed  on  the USB  (for  a trial,  so  to speak,  we do not believe that Clover is even able to work?!), then the launch with a debagon can  last

Ten minutes. Yes, it's real. This is because the debage log opens, closes and is rewritten on a flash drive on each line. This is to ensure that you get information about the success of thelaunch even with a forced cut, so if you went to the debug, wait! or for the first attempt to put a zlt'false/qgt;.

2.   There are too many drives, sections and files on them.

Clover to compile the launch menu, dothe wives scan all the discs, all the sections, and all the files on them to find out what systems you can offer to run.

<key>GUI</key>

<dict>

<true/>

3.   Huge Windows or Linux section, and not even  onein.

The Windowes section is scanned if the driver's NTFS is available. And in this section, usually a million files, and among them we are going to look for bootmgr.efi.

I would recommend installing Windows so that this file is on the EFI section and the NTFS.efi driver should be removed altogether, and thus not to scan the Vindows sections.

It's the same with the Linux section and the VBoxExt2.efi driver.

4.   Too many drivers in the folder  /EFI/CLOVER/drivers/

I foresee a situation where people start producing their own drivers of this type, and there will be those willing to try them. At this point, think about whether you need an extra keyboard driver, mouse, LowMemoryFix... The fact is that if you runout of ESS, then reading all these files can take time.

5.   Unsupportedmouse.

Unfortunately, not all mice are supported by the EFI driver that we have. A bad mouse can behave on the screen incorrectly, or give hard brakes.

Ban her for inspection, or even forever, if it's wrong

Analyzing Debug.log/Preboot.log

What for? Clover will give you information about the iron that you won't see from the characterto the site, and will also talk about how he copes with configuration before you run the system.

How to get it? I will say at once that it is the same thing, with a difference in success and speed. To get a preboot.log, go to Clover's shell (GUI) and press the F2. Preboot file.log will be stored in clover EFI/CLOVER/misc/File/.

ends with the phrase Enter GUI, which is logical. However, if you download the system, the file will end at the start of the system itself, that isall that you can.

If Clover is hanging, it will help debug.log. To get it, put in a confit

<key>Boot</key>

<dict>

<key>Debug</key>

<true/>

In this case, the file is created line-by-line, and you are guaranteed to find a stop in it. Example:

222:890    0:001        DefaultIndex=-1 and MainMenu.EntryCount=7  222:892                0:001                 SetScreenResolution: 1366x768 - already set 0:100          0:100       MemLog inited, TSC freq:  2591578780

0:100        0:000        CPU was calibrated with ACPI PM  Timer

Here we see that after the message about the change of screen resolution began a new log.

Let's look now at what we see in the log.

 

MemLog inited, TSC freq: 2591583140

Here's the initial clock speed of the processor. By standard, the processor starts with one core at maximum non-turbo frequency. If you don't, hit the bells urgently! It won't  work. Such situations are  rare,  and each timewe are individually taken with special amendments ofClover.     Round  it  will  only be in utilities that    are rounding for easy display.

 

Now is  14.7.2019,               8:47:7  (GMT)

The date and time of the greenwich launch. In Moscow, the local time will be 3. We distinguish the old log from the new one.

Launch OSX on unsupported iron

Actually, the whole book is about THIS. I'll talk here in part, starting  from the question.

Unsupported BIOS. I'd love to. It is about Hakintoshi that we are talking about.        It's  the DMI data  that  contains    the  manufacturer's  name  (should  be Apple inc.), the model and the serial number, the numbers and  letters  in  which the numbers are not random, they mean something, in particular the model and  the production    date.  

However, it is recommended to generate your serials, and may take a model different from the model by default.

 

Unsupportedprocessor. Yes, different versions of  MACOs support different CPU sets, and your processor may not be supported.

Here's a table on the old systems:

 

 

 

 

 

1

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

1

 

 

 

and so on

 

That is,  Yonah  and XeonMP support is discontinued; the newer processor the newer the system is required; The atom  was never maintained,    although the seemingly ordinary Intel processor. The plate is  out of date, look at the sources of  XNU. Skylake,  for example,  is supported at 10.11.6 and above.

When you run the system on an unsupported processor, you get a core panic. To prevent it is a patch KernelCpu'true. It simply replaces the panic call on an empty operator, and everything continues to work. In Clover's new revisions, I made a Patch FakeCPUID'0x010676. And closeto your processor (about the same generation, such as Atom should be replaced by Penrin, or even Conroy get_cpu_info).

Example:

<key>KernelAndKextPatches</key>

<dict>

<key>FakeCPUID</key>

<string>0x010676</string>

 

Unsupported video ofart.

Intel. Supported: GMA950, X3100, HD3000, and above. Alas,  no substitutions do not help. For                   each  option, there is a set of patches, and if the graphics card is different, then at best you  will  have a picture, without the possibility of changing permission, and   without any 3D  effects. 

Nvidia. 7300-7600 cards are only supported until the 10.7.5 system in 32-bit mode.

There are some questions to The Fermi 4/5 x cards. They should also be classifiedas partially supported, and only up to the 10.11.6 system.

For systems 10.12 and above, only Kepler,the GK family,is running, and the GK familyneeds a WEB driver that exists only until the 10.13.6 system. These are GTX 6xxx-7xxx cards, but not all of them, among them there are also Fermi, then a bummer. 

ATI/AMD.The whole story.On systems 10.13 and above Radeon series 6000 and below do not work.

Now here's  another WhateverGreen  from  vit9696 - "driver of all video cards, just put the latest version, as well as the latest version of  Lila,  and do not think about anything. In Clover, you need to disable everything related to the graphics cards." But I don't play like that!  Who  doesn't  want to  sort it out, please use.

Maps 5700      work only  starting from Catalina. 


The sound card. Professional cards usually have a driver for Mack.

HDA  chipnet codex is supported by all with VoodooHDA cupcake. The  native AppleHDA  cupcake does not support any of the codeces  present on the market. Once upon a time  there was ALC885, but now itdoes notcome. But  hackers  have developed a technique of  AppleHDA patch so that it supports almost any desired realtec chip (i.e. ALCxxx). Clover helps to correct DSDT  under this  muffin,  and offers ways to patch the cupcake  on  the fly. What exactly to patch and  how to read on the forums. HDMI Audio works with  KDDT patches in Clover, however,  does not work with  some  AMD cards. But  in the systems of 10.13, there is a new driver AppleGFXHDA.kext, study!

Network map. First, Apple drivers are underthe pull of a number of          chips.  In  some  cases, it is enough to make FakeID for the card, so that it was included in the list of supported by native avers,but in most cases you need aseparate  cupcake.

WiFi. . . and here everything is very sad. Intel doesn't  have any. Clover can help with FakeID,  for example in my version of the Boadcom4315 spoof on supported 4312.

From 2020, a driver for some Intel WiFi cards has appeared on the network. There are chances!

 

Block cupcake

Happened to me to install a Geenna.kext muffin in the SLE system folder. On the panic screen, after the reboot, this cupcake is loaded first, and immediately panic. So what do we do now? It needs to be removed, but there is no other system on this computer yet. For thispurpose, Clover introduced an additional feature: in Options Menu in the third line enter Block kext: Geenna  and quietly download the system in single user mode (a space on the system icon).

fsck -fy mount -uw /

rm -r -v /S*/L*/Ex*/Geenna.kext reboot

The rebut is necessary here, otherwise the kernel will still load this cupcake with the next step, and again

there will be panic.

The new Clover has a new technique: put all our cupcakes in the folder EFI/CLOVER/kexts/Other. And in clover Details menu (space) we'll find a spoof to lock/unlock cupcakes.

 

Starting with the 5052 audit, it was possible to store the cupcakes  in the Off folder and  plug them into  the same menu as  needed

 

The cupcakes  in the Other  folder are connected by default and off in the Off  folder,  but  are visible to Clover to connect.   


Slot name (AAPL, slot-name)

It's mostly cosmetics, although there are claims that it will obligeyou to eat in some cases.

 

Where does the system get the slot name from? In the old way, it was tried to inject through the _DSM property "AAPL, slot-name", but this is completely wrong method for treats the consequence instead of the cause. This property is exhibited by The AppleSMBIOS system cupcakeon the basis of the ACPI of the _SUN properties and D _SUN MI tables.
